text:
Service was horrible. No one took our drink orders, the waitress took our food order, but didn't ask about drinks until we had to ask someone about it. 

5 people at our table and they brought out each dish one at a time with several minutes in between. Who does that? 

Waitress disappeared when it was time for the check, the manager finally brought it over and finished for her. While we were eating we saw another party waiting at the door for their check. 

Food was great if you don't mind bad service.
My Fav Thai/Chinese restaurant in Vegas! Such a variety of food to choose from. There's even a vegetarian menu. Tofu Satae is my favorite appetizer. It comes with toast & a cucumber salad.

Pretty good food at decent prices and relatively large portions. Been to Kung Fu several times and would definitely go back. Go give this place a try it isn't the best but it is pretty good and cheap.

Ive been eating at Kung Fu for years. Anyone Ive ever taken there or ordered with loves it. They deliver! I have not found crab rangoon anywhere that compares to theirs. You order the spice of a dish on a hotness level 1-10. They could be a little more consistent with that but I think it depends on the cook. I dont like too hot so I order a 1 or 2 which sometimes can feel more like a 4 or 5.. but overall, the best Chinese & Thai cuisine.

Kung Fu Plaza Restaurant is one of the first restaurants you see as you enter Las Vegas Chinatown from the strip. I can't stand the name of the restaurant, but the food is not too shabby. A few years ago, I thought this place was the bomb, but I think because of the combination of food we ordered, I left feeling underwhelmed. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't so spectacular either. This restaurant offers both Thai and Chinese cuisine.

Gotta have Tom Yum. We ordered the seafood. For 13 bucks, they didn't give us much soup, and the seafood was sparse, but it tasted alright. 

The Pad Thai was decent. Kind of hard to mess up pad thai.

My sister ordered the Cashew Chicken. This was just an average dish. 

The Pan-fried Catfish was everyone's favorite. The fish wasn't perfectly fried by a long shot, but the sauce was very good. I'm not sure why it says that the sauce is "curry like" on the menu, but it was a bit spicy, and the basil added fragrance. I love spicy! 

Ok, let me tell you about this dish that hubby ordered. He has a history of ordering bad dishes. This was the Pa Nang Curry with Beef. It was like scooping a spoonful of peanut butter into my mouth. My mom said it was "so weird" in Vietnamese. It was.

Lots of photos and full review on my blog.

Finding parking is a freaken pain in the ass in this plaza, but its worth it cause the food here is great! Kung fu has been around in vegas for decades and decades LITERALLY. The service here is great, they alwayse take the time to see if your enjoying your food and filling your glass of water without being ask. The seating is actually pretty quick depending on the time of the day you show up. 

     We alwayse order yum moo yang( grill pork sald) it is sooooo delicious :) a good blend of sweet and heat. There soy sauce duck is also yummy, especially over hot steamy rice. Every thing that we order here has been delicious so far the only downside I have is parking but what do you expect its CHINATOWN haha.

chicken pad thai was delicious 

combination fried rice was yummy but a little oily

fried chicken wings was really crunchy but there was too much batter and it didn't really have a taste...you're supposed to use the dip but I didn't like it because it was too sweet

squid salad was so good, but a little spicy for a 7/10 spicy rating

tofu vegetarian curry was not good, it wasn't very flavorful

mango sticky rice was the best I've ever had

stir fry lo mein noodles with seafood was yummy 

--

overall, if you're in the mood for greasy Thai food, this is awesome for $10-$15 a plate

Place wasn't really busy when we arrived on Christmas day in late afternoon so we didn't have to wait long. Food was good as ever and our server was nice and helpful as we wanted to try something we haven't had before. Was hectic when we were going to leave so took a bit to get our check and to go boxes.  Overall as good as it's always been
The food was well prepared and fresh. Service was slow enough that it almost cost them a star.

Edit:  I don't like this place anymore!  Last experience- the shrimp pad thai was really blah, had no shrimp in it so I had to ask for some, and came with fried rice which I didn't even want (and so less pad thai).  Also service was really slow for lunch.  It's such a huge room too, you just don't get the kind of personal service that you can get somewhere else, like Prommares.

I was in search of Shrimp Pad Thai and found this via google. Ordered placed for pick-up, ready in 15 mins...Great! 

Parking was down a dimly lit drive thru/alley way. Got startled by what appeared to be a worker smoking in the corner; may I suggest you park on Spring Mt and walk around to Valley. 

Upon entering the restaurant, the staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was inviting. I must say the dish was very tasty with a spicy level of 4. 

The only complaint were the noodles were thinner than what I was used to, almost like angel hair pasta, and the shrimp were the tiny ones; I was a little disappointed, but yet it was still very tasty. You can order up for larger shrimp, but since it was my first time I wanted to experience the regular dish. If I had to eat here again, I would definitely order the larger shrimp next time.

Excellent! One of the best Thai restaurants I've had, and I've tried quite a few. Perfect amount of spice and flavor in every dish. We ordered 4 entrees and 2 appetizers and had it delivered. The delivery was 45min to 1 hour as promised and the food was still hot. Everything we ordered was in the bags. I highly recommend!

We wanted something different so we went for Oriental food and we found this restaurant on Vegas.com for best restaurants in Vegas. This restaurant is family owned and run for many years it does take a while to get your food because they are very busy but the wait was well worth it.

TREATED SO BADLY AFTER BEING A LOYAL CUSTOMER FOR 5 YEARS!!!! I have been ordering delivery from this place for 5 years, I called tonight to place an order and the lady on the phone rudely told me we don't deliver to you anymore! I tried to explain to her that they have delivered to me 2-3 a month for the last 5 years, she now starting yelling at me and said I told you 20 times we do not deliver there and hung up on me. I work In a casino/hotel on the strip and have always recommended them to guests and also ordered huge orders for my department! They charge for delivery but have always tipped 20-25 percent. I am so disappointed in this establishment of how they treated me and I will pass it on to everyone I know! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! You lost a great customer! Zero stars for you Kung Fu, you should be ashamed of your behavior!!!!!!!!!
Tom Yum was amazing, everything else seemed to be a little too sweet. Other then it's a really quite place to go eat.

Wanted to try a restaurant in Chinatown while we were in Vegas.  This was our favorite - we love Thai food and this place is great.  The dishes are authentic. The Tom Ga Ghi Chicken/coconut soup was the best I have ever had.  The Garlic pork is fantastic.  The Panag Beef was so good we had to order a second plate.  Everything can be shared family style and everyone loved the dishes.  Will definitely come back when we are in Vegas again.
The garlic chicken is awesome. And the pad Thai is about the best ever.  We checked out the reviews and was do happy we did.

Kung Fu has one of the best lunch specials in Vegas. For $5.95 you get soup, an entree with steamed or fried rice, an egg roll and a fried chicken wing from 11-3pm.

The rest of the menu is very exhaustive including Thai and Chinese dishes. The hot pots of soup are intense and delicious, better for parties of 3 or more.

The food is rich and flavorful and none of the staff speaks much English*, which means the cook are Thai and know what they're doing.

*In an effort to not sound offensive, if you want people to speak perfect English get some generic food from Panda Express.

This place is like our Thai Food home. We have a party of 5 at least, and we visit them about once a month or more. Have always liked their food. Service depends on who you get as your server. But it's not like they are really bad. We once wanted one of our dishes kinda customized and the server helped us do it, and we had a great deep fried Calamari in butter sauce. Amazing!!!
The food is always great, nothing to complain there. If you love Thai food and want a good authentic taste, this is a sure hot point!!!!

This place is pretty freaking good.
Totally took me by surprise.
I came for dinner and I will usually order pad see ew but since I was with a large group we decided to eat family style.
Lucky me!

We ordered:
Beef sate'
Tom yum goong
Tom kaa chicken
Mint chicken
Pork plik king
Curry catfish of some sort
Red beef curry
I was very impressed with all the above dishes.
In fact I came back the next day just to try the pad see ew, and that was also very good.
Well balanced flavors with just enough kick for this westerner to get a good idea of what they are working with.

The Thai iced tea was also prepared very well and had way too much milk just the way I like it.

The only thing that was lacking was the interior was a bit dated.
But im not here to eat the painting on the wall.
Also the service was not as attentive as I would have liked.
We had to wave down the waiter numerous times.
And lastly the food is a bit more expensive than I expected. 

But the food is very good.
Kung fu may not sound like an authentic Thai food restaurant but damn the food is pretty good.
So ignore the name and concentrate on the food.
Positive note for next time: Looks like they have a full bar.

Food: A
Service: C
Price: B
Overall: Solid B+

Now go eat and be merry!!!

Been going here for years. Great authentic Thai food! My favorite dish to order here is Pad Thai, they use slightly thinner noodles....what a difference!  If you like Thai food then go here! Only downside to this place is sometimes you receive less than stellar service, but that doesn't stop me from going.

I have to say this is my favorite Chinese food spot in Vegas. I always order the sweet and sour shrimp with my meal and it is always fantastic. The last time I went, I went with my son. He ordered the whole fried catfish and you should of seen when the waiter sat it down in front of him. He almost jumped out his skin. 

But kids aside, ordering whole catfish when they don't know what to expect and aren't listening to the adults tell them it is a whole catfish the food is always great and the service matches it. Oh, the catfish was fantastic with the chili sauce being delightfully unique.
40mins later and still waiting for my order! My first time here and I'm never coming back..

This place is a little bit of a dive and you are definitely left in the front area for a while before being seated.  When we were waited on, the food came out quickly and was really good.  My office is close by so normally, I have it delivered.  It's a little pricey that way but the portions are much bigger.  I wind up having tons of leftovers.  

Mongolian beef is my favorite.  The Tom Kha is really good too.  Totally worth trying.

This restaurant is from the 70's and you can tell. There's an odd smell that hits you as soon as you walk in it's a smell that is obviously rising from the old carpet that needs to be replaced! I ordered the Tom Kai Gai with chicken and when I received my food I noticed the chicken was undercooked. I let my server know and he   told me the food is fine. I told him I wouldn't eat uncooked chicken so he let me know I didn't have to but I couldn't order anything else off the menu because he wasn't going to pay for my meal. I was very disappointed in how I was treated and I'll never go back to this place. If they have a no return policy for nasty undercooked food then they should post that somewhere!
Atmosphere is ok, Tom yum gong is ok, everything else is so so. Food came really fast which is great, but it's a pity that the food was too salty. Most likely won't return.

Had a Tom type of soup with coconut milk that was really fantastic. 

Tried #31 which was very good glass noodle dish with a dressing and meat shrimp and scallops. The chinese dish we tried was more bland but very good. The help was nice and service was pretty quick for our late lunch. I'd go back and recommend to a friend.

Adequate service, they could have tried to be at least more attentive. I even asked for those 4 chili sauces from one of the waiters and I still didn't even get it when my table and I finished our food. And we had to seat ourselves in because they weren't even paying attention to is near the entrance. But I must say, I've tried Thai restaurants from both California and Nevada and this place has good food, the dishes here are so perfectly seasoned, there is no too sweet, too plain, or too salty or not enough saltiness. Probably coming back again when I visit Las Vegas.

With a previous night of drunken debauchery in Sin City - Vegas we leave our beautiful suite at Palazzo and look for some good sober-up yet cold-weather warming food. Votes in - and THAI food it is! But where? So I remember heading out to Chinatown in a prior visit to Vegas a couple months back at Kung Fu! CHEAP, GOOD, and did I mention...GOOD!
So 15 minutes later we're there and were seated promptly. Luckily, it was already after lunchtime  so we didn't encounter any wait time. 
We all chose to order dishes and share the portions. Tom Yum (HOT - of course), Pad Thai, some beef salad, and shrimp fried rice! 
The guys were digging the food but like myself, they agreed the service was aiiiiight! Could have been better (hence the 4 stars). SO - if you're in vegas and have a hankerin' for some Thai/Chinese (good decent and reminiscent of SGV style) hit Kung Fu up! It'll make you say...."HAAAAY YA!" LOL!

The food here is excellent.  Both dine-in and delivery.  We always go with the Mongolian beef, cashew chicken, jumbo shrimp fried rice, and tom ka soup.

I've had a couple issues with online orders getting lost (so make sure to call and confirm after placing an online order).  The small Asian knick knacks in the interior of the restaurant could use a good dusting/cleaning.  Once you notice, it gets really distracting.
I have been here a few times with my family and love their food! The cashew chicken and Mongolian beef are a must try.

This place is amazing! The food is great snd reasonably priced and the portions are hefty. They have great thai tea here which is a must have. The Basil fried rice is fantastic if you are a fan of that dish. The beef dishes are also tasty. A must visit if your in the vegas area. The service is also great!

I wish yelp had option of zero stars...or negative score.This is literally the worst Chinese restaurant we have ever been in. We ordered 2 plates of fried rice, 1 plate of kung pao chicken, 1 plate of spicy cat fish. We then added an order of shrimp. After waiting for close to 45 minutes!!!!!, and watching other people getting served who came way after us, and multiple enquiries, we got only the shrimp dish. Again after multiple queries, we got the full order, but only one serving of rice. The catfish was burnt beyond imagination. The shrimp tasted like a reheated plate...very leathery and burnt crispy. An old lady (may be owner or management ) asked us "how was it"...we said we are really disappointed.  Her response.." you still finished your food, didn't you"...!!!!!!

My friends and i always come here on our trips to vegas. It's almost a tradition. You can get great food at decent prices.  We don't like to eat all our meals by the strip.  It gets way too pricey.  We usually order the chop chicken with basil and the crispy pork. It's very similar to stuff i can find in LA if i want a taste of home, but different enough that i still find it special.
Fast delivery and great food!   If you try nothing else get the crispy pork,  beef jerky and the fried shrimp!   Delish!

I love this place! My dad and I used to eat here every week when we lived on that side of town. We'd get the Kung Pao Shrimp and pork pot stickers, they are absolutely delicious. The wait staff is very knowledgeable and friendly as well. I also recommend their soups. Whenever I get a bad cold in the winter I always go here and get a big bowl of their soup, it always hits the spot. If you love Chinese food in a friendly environment, come here!

The service is very slow. I had to wave a waitress down after waiting 10 minutes. We ordered fried catfish, orange chicken, poah taek soup. I give it 4 stars for no flavor. The staff is very inattentive and they ran out of most of the appetizers like the fish cakes and sate and jerky at only 630pm. I'm used to flavorful food in SoCal but this place just had no flavor. Such a disappointment!

I can only rate the Thai part of the menu, which was good. Nothing that stood out as spectacular, but good. Be warned that their idea of "medium" spice is pretty spicy! We heard others at the table next to us saying the same thing.

Their food was absolutely delicious. The only reason i didn't give the 5th star was that it TOOK OVER AN HOUR TO DELIVER and we are about 10 minutes away. I ordered the Bean Sprouts and Jumbo Shrimp with jasmine rice and my coworker ordered the lunch special Orange Chicken and Fried rice. No complaints here and i will order again.

The stucco walls are really smooth. I mean brilliantly done. Whichever Kung Fu Master learned to lay stucco must have been a 7th degree in construction. I mean . . . keeeyyy-yyyahhhh, they chopped the hell out of these smooth walls.

I bow to the stucco master and his smooth kicking style. The walls were kicked into submission. Arigotu Mr. wall-botu!

ok...this is my second time trying this place because i had to give it the benefit of the doubt....I only proved my point the second time around....the food is overcooked and extremely dry.Both times I had the mongolian beef lunch special....now i'm no master chef but believe me i had to drink about a gallon and a half of water just to swallow this food....very very dry meat that obviously was overcooked.even my co workers said the same about their dishes...definitely will not eat from there again....i know we live in the desert here but at least make the food moist.
Seriously some of the best Mongolian Beef I've ever had.  Phone service was efficient and friendly, as was their driver.  Pray that you live within their delivery area.

The food is sooooooo good, however their service isn't. Be prepared to wait... For a long time for any help. Lunch specials are only on weekdays. The chop chicken chili is my favorite, spicy level 8... Anything below isn't very spicy. The Mongolian beef spicy level 8 is also really good, as well as their Thai Teas. For quality of food though and variety this place is one of the best.

Was looking for some good chinese to feed a hungry crew after a convention in Vegas.  The hotel recommended Kung Fu so we figured ok we'll give them a try.  WOW!  They were so friendly on the phone, very helpful with directions.  The food was great and everyone was really satisfied at the end of the meal.  They were very accomodating with plates, forks, napkins, and even provided serving spoons which was really nice.

Why not 5 stars?  I had called about 45 minutes ahead.  When we arrived to pick up the food at the agreed upon time, it quickly became apparant that they hadn't even started preparing it yet.  I think they didn't believe we wer going to actually show up.  So we had to wait about 30 minutes, which was kind of a drag.  Other than that, great experience and I would definitely recommend this place, and go back if the opportunity presents itself on a future trip to Vegas.

The name doesn't sound like a good/authentic Thai place. But I have to admit this place served the best Thai I had ever had. I had tried Thai in many places such as Toronto, London (UK), Malaysia, Hong Kong, Singapore - this is by far the best Thai!! We ordered Mango salad, Tom Yum Soup and Pineapple Fried Rice. We ended up finishing everything on the table! I will go back to Vegas one day just for this restaurant!

Definitely NOT a good experience. Our waitress was horrible. We ordered wine right off the bat...it never arrived and the woman had the audacity to tell us we hadn't ordered it by showing us her chicken scratch on a notepad. As if we would have any clue what her cryptic symbols meant. Anyhow, to top it off, our order arrived in waves. Half of the party was finished eating before other orders arrived. The waitress told us (again by showing the notepad) that we hadn't ordered the meal that was forgotten. Strange, we all recalled the order details. Regardless, another member of the staff magically got the order to appear. Sodas were never refilled, the place was a huge disappointment. We took our kids there to practice their mandarin and couldn't find anyone that spoke the language. Why are you in chinatown??? Chinese buffets in malls would be better options. Don't be fooled by the overall decent star rating!!! Oh yeah, and the only hot sauce they could find was mustard. HUH???
I love the pad thai it's so yummy and their thai iced tea is too bomb  the best thai food I ever tasted

This was the worst Thai food I've ever eaten.  Not to mention the worst service.  The only reason I tried this place was because the Thai restaurant across the street was close that day.  Wish I would have mcdonalds instead of this crap.  Priced way to high too.  Just a really bad choice if you eat here..

horrible experience. We ordered our food online 2 hours ago and still NO FOOD. we just called and they clearly have no idea that we even ordered, we've talked to 3 different people in the past hour about our food. The last time we called she offered to retake our order and start from scratch. Meanwhile, the credit card was charged for food we never received. The lady took our number and said the "computer is broken" and the boss will call me back later for a refund. Worst experience i've had with lunch. My lunch hour is now :(

Unbelievably fantastic thai food at a very reasonable price! I had the Mongollian Beef at the heat level of five (they ask you what heat level you want your food from 1-10) and it was simply PERFECT! Great service too. 
Suggestion on how to get there if you're staying on the strip: Take the free shuttle from either Harrahs or Ballys to Rio and then walk about a quarter of a mile up valley view rd. to Kung Fu. Believe me, its worth the walk. Delish!
Best thai food in town. Almost as good as moms cooking! Food is fast but sometimes appetizers come after main course, that's why only 4 stars.excuse the half eaten plates...
After being dissatisfied with buffet asia we decided to finally try this place, best decision ! Very clean and attentive and also very quick. The food was amazing definitely going back !

I have been coming here for years and it is hands down my favorite Chinese and Thai restaurant in town. Hundreds of items to choose from and anything I've ever ordered has been delicious. Also, quite affordable.

First off I'd like to preface this review by saying that I've being going here for at least the past 6 years. Service has always been just alright, but you would think since I come I'm in quite a bit, that'd would have at least changed. Nope. I also want to say that by far, they have my FAVORITE Tom Yum and Yum Woonsen. Order it every time. No other restaurant makes it as good as they do. But to the docking of stars. My husband no longer wants to dine here after basically being ignored one visit. We were barely acknowledged, just enough so that we finally got to place an order after being seated for 20 minutes ( again, we know what we want and just wasn't approached prior to this.) When we got our food, I was willing to dismiss the lack of service in the beginning, because the food is just so dang good and  I had an ok history with them. Buuuut, we weren't even on their radar during the meal. Our waters were not once refilled (or offered), no one asked how our meal was, or even if we would like anything else. Nothing. My husband was furious. We talked to them about how we felt neglected from the awful service, and their decision? Give us 10% off. Um. Ok. We are very reasonable people and are pretty polite, even if it comes down to complaining. Had we had a large bill, 10% would have been sufficient. But for two meals, they basically covered tax. Poor customer service recovery, in my opinion, especially for someone that has frequented there often. 
Really disappointed.
Love it! my fav is the Thai beef salad.......yum. Anything you order is delish.

don't go here, go to Pin Kow. 

parking is terrible. 
service is even worse. the guy who seated us, also took our order and cleared the table. they are understaffed and very un-accommodating. (no, you can't substitute shrimp for chicken) it took us forever to get our food, and even longer to get the check. not to mention the food came out staggered, my husband got his entree, then they brought out the appetizers, then another entree...
food quality was not good; very bland and not fresh. no condiments on the table, and not even enough for each table. they also didn't have enough menus for everybody. 
over all appearance and quality of the restaurant was poor.

I've come to realize now, that reviews don't mean crap; so no longer am I reading reviews before I place an order. Because all the positive words don't reflect anything if the food ain't good! Just bcuz someone else had a positive encounter doesn't mean you're going to have the same and I have realized that I am just going to order with whoever I choose, because it's a gamble either way. I read the reviews first and the food was still garbage. $27.00 down the drain, cause I literally threw away both entrees, the combination fried rice( the rice had absolutely no flavor and the meat was regurgitating), and the combination platter(appetizers),. the shrimp, egg rolls, and the potstickers and thai chicken were absolutely horrifying. I couldn't digest nothing of the entire order. Never again will I waste my money, I cannot believe Las Vegas and the hype about everything being the best and the food here has been GARBAGE.
I love Kung Fu, great food served promptly, great service, calming atmosphere, and a huge menu to choose from...it works for me every time.

Can't put zero star, too bad.. Almost 2 hours wait for our food to be delivered and we live 2 blocks away.. The food was really disgusting, wonton soup was pink (because the pork inside was pink!), rice was disgusting (how you mess you rice up!?), bbq pork was allright... So overall, i guess i won't order from them ever again... :/

This is the best tasting thai food in town hands down!!!! I always order the chopped chicken chili and mints so goood with a jumbo thai ice tea. Place is usually busy and at times the service is slow but well worth it to grub in some bomb thai food.

I used to live within walking distance to this place, so it was one of my go to places! For Chinese though, not so much Thai with one of my favorite Thai places across the street. Awesome prices, especially for lunch, and decent food. It's not at the Joyful level in terms of quality but Kung Fu with definitely 'get er done!'

One of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to.  Every time we're in town, we make sure to eat here at least once.  We've even ordered to go on our ride back to Cali a couple of times.
This is what we usually order and have never been disappointed:

Papaya salad w/ salted crab - THE BEST
Tom Yum Goong
Pad Se Ew seafood
Beef noodle soup
House fried rice

Can't wait to go back in April!
What a great find on Las Vegas! The Pad See Ew with Angus beef was divine. Can't wait to come back and try every single dish!

After waiting more than TWO HOURS for a delivery, I was shocked to see such a small amount of food for the $60 spent.  STONE COLD food I should mention.  The Thai wings and fried shrimp were just huge blots of fried  cold batter.... lots of dried out boiled rice and two very small containers of tasteless, limp cold food.  THEN they hit me up for a $4 delivery charge............

GO TO WEERA - HEARD EXCELLENT THINGS AND WILL TRY IT NEXT TIME.  KUNG FU THAI - YOU SUCK!!!

I love asian food especially Thai. I work so much, never have time to eat out, quick delivery is important to me. Great food, friendly service and they understand english when I call to order food. Well as along as you take your time when you talk.

I also like the fact that they have a good vegetarian menu. 

LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!
I have a friend have a dinner in this restaurant .  They charge 20% tips on bill.     And they didn't tell me already charge tips

After reading the good reviews I decided to give it a try.  Nice ornament and decoration... that is the only thing I like about this place.  I ordered from the Thai side of the menu, but very very plain, so plain that I don't even remember what I ordered.
Good flavors, decent portions, shrimp was rubbery though.  Great place for large parties, very accommodating.

Usually get good service, but not all the time. I sat there 15 minutes today at lunch with my wife and watched 3 tables come in after us, and all order. Meanwhile we sat there with water and no menu's, and no orders taken from us (drinks or food). We had enough after table 4 came in and ordered. We just left, having only tried the water (and still no one noticed us)! There was only 5-7 tables in the whole place at the time!

This is a Thai and Chinese Restaurant, but I never order Chinese food here because I'm Chinese and well, I just don't want to be disappointed.  Their Thai food is excellent though!  I always order the same three dishes:  the fried chicken wings, the pork salad, and the mint chicken.  So if you want really really good food, order these three items!

The fried chicken wings have almost never failed me, except maybe once or twice in 5 years.  I love how crunchy it is on the outside and how moist it is in the inside.  They don't seem to put much spices or salt on it, and it's just delicious the way it is.  The pork salad is also really good, and it's kind of sour, sweet, and savory.  The mint chicken is also to die for.  There's just something about it that is better than any other versions of mint/basil chicken I have ever had at Thai restaurants.  Give me some of that with the jasmine rice and I'm good to go.

Their service is not always the best, but servers are always polite and fast.  I've never had a problem with a long wait.  Of all Thai places I've tried, this is still my favorite!  Maybe because I LOVE me some good crunchy and crispy chicken wings and this is as good as it gets!

I dunno, maybe I didn't order the right thing. The vegetarian selection had the standard dishes but the dish that caught my eye was the Mongolian tofu. We also ordered the fried spring rolls, papaya salad and a glass noodle soup.

The Mongolian tofu dish was deep friend tofu cubes which I normally LOVE, but it was soggy and oily. The 'mixed veggies'  with it were very sparse. The sauce was so-so.

The spring rolls and papaya salad were decent... no better than other places.

The veggie glass noddle soup was a load of noodles in a tasteless broth with lacking veggies.

P.S. I thought about a return visit to try other dishes but I would much rather go to Komols, Ping Pong, Hue Thai or Veggie Delight. Always good.
I am a regular here their seafood soup is great. they are open 24 seven that's the best I strongly recommend the food and customer service.

We love Thai Food and are just in town from Phoenix for a few days and decided to stop in China Town. The food was great and the service was happy. My companions meals came out way after mine but they apologized and made amends . Definitely excellent Curry dishes and my Laad Na was great. We  have found our place to eat in Vegas.

Horrible service, worse then a fast food joint that is slammed as f* and has a 16 year old working the window. Tell me why all they did was take our order 20 minutes after being seated, drop off the food and never come back to check on us. Don't waste your time. There's better places on spring mountain that will satisfy your Chinese or Thai food cravings

This is a nice restaurant. My family always come here for Thai food whenever we are in vegas. 

From all the times we have came here, this place is amazing. Its Thai food is very similar to actual Thai food. I can't comment on chinese food though.

My only complaint is that they put one dish down at a time instead of putting down all the dishes at the same time.

I live in NLV and was in the area. I figured Chinese food in Chinatown had to be good.  There was a lot of people waiting outside but when we went in to ask how long the wait was we were told a few minutes.  We got lucky because everyone else who came in after us were ignored.  We were seated about 15 minutes later then ignored.  Someone came up with menus after we were seated for about 5 minutes then no one came back.  The people around us who had been seated after us had water and their orders taken.  I finally grabbed a busboy and asked him to get me a waiter.  The waiter finally showed up and we ordered appetizers as well as dinner.  My daughter ordered soup for dinner which even though it was obvious that's all she was getting,  they brought it with the drinks then the appetizers came after about 30 minutes then our dinner almost immediately.  I had the Mongolian beef which was small but the meat was good.  I think the food would have been better if I didn't have such a bad taste in my mouth from the service - or lack thereof.

Great find! We were visiting Vegas and my Hubby was in the mood for Chinese so we took a chance and stopped here. We were very pleased to have found such an authentic Thai and Chinese restaurant. Clean, friendly and prompt.

Always order from here good food.. they forgot my coconut ice cream tonight and I just didn't feel like calling them back about it.. about 20 minutes later I get a knock on the door... my ice cream!!! Thank you for the consideration!! Now I can enjoy movie night!!!!

Been there 3 times. Each time was really good. (Got it to go each time). First time I got pork chow mein. Really enjoyed it. Other two times I got Mongolian beef. You get to choose how spicy you want it from 1-10. First time I got a 5, then I got an 8 the second time. Going back to 5! Planning on going back!

we are giving them 1 start because that's the only option, this place is terrible, we order Kung pao shrim and they give us 5 shrimps with tons of ginger it did not taste like Kung pao at all.
my husband order pad Thai shrimp and the noodle was like anger air pasta w mini tiny shrimps. the prices are crazy we pay $50 for a really bad dinner!! don't ever order in this place

Good food, terrible service. The food was good and in reasonable portions but I hardly ever saw my waiter. It wasn't that they were busy; there were two large tables that were all Asian that got seen constantly without any trouble. After they took my plate away I waited 15min for my check, in that time both tables entered, got seated and ordered their food by the same waiter. It was the first time I've ever not left a tip because I was genuinely offended at their service. Quality wise I'd order take out next time but on principle I'll never give them business again.

Loved the chicken wings and vegetables with crispy pork. The General Tso's was a bit more sweet than spicy for my taste. Unlike other reviewers, our service was pretty decent. Definitely coming back to try something else.

Note: This is a review on my take-out only experiences with this restaurant. (4 in total)

Kung Fu Plaza brands itself as a Chinese-Thai eatery, but my experience has been that its Chinese dishes do not taste authentic at all. 

The chicken noodle soup is extremely oily, to the point of being inedible. I had ordered this for a sick friend, and was quite unhappy about its quality. The wonton soup is much better, but nothing above the ordinary. The hot and sour soup is nowhere near the regular Szechuan version that you would expect - this one is orangey-yellow. The chow mein is passable, but your best bet is probably the thai curries, which are quite tasty, and as a plus, taste good as leftovers.

What I do like about them is their cheerful and quick service.

Just had the lunch special good price, nice portion but zero flavor,  the moo goo just tastes like nothing really.  Fried rice zero flavor , everything was cooked but seems like the salt was forgotten.  Not sure why this is a go to spot for a lot of people. Will give it another try but right now food has like blah.

Been going to this little hole in the wall for years. Ongchoi with crispy pork a must try. Stuffed chicken wing iv not had better in town. Feels like a mom and pop joint. In this case looks can be deceiving dont judge this book by its cover. Thai food the right way.
Don't ever try their wonton noodles , it tasted exactly like the instant wonton noodles except that it was worse.
Excellent service. Best Chinese/Thai restaurant in town. Highly recommended.

I'm visiting Vegas for a convention. Unfortunately, my hotel is off the strip and with 104 degree temperatures the last thing I wanted to do was go back out in the heat for food. Did an Internet search for places that deliver. A million pizza joints, but I wanted something different. Came across some good reviews for Kung Fu so I placed an online order.

About two minutes after the order was placed, a gentleman called from Kung Fu to verify some of the things on my order. Whhaaaaat? A restaurant that doesn't just guess but actually follows up with the customer? Amazing! He told me the food would be delivered in an hour but it was more like 30-45 minutes.

And it was sooooo good. I was craving egg drop soup and theirs didn't disappoint. I had also ordered the chicken with chili and mint over rice and received a HUGE portion for the price. Got a large drink too. Cost for everything plus delivery and tip was only about $22, making it more than worth it. Not to mention the awesomeness of having it delivered to my hotel.

Definitely will be keeping this one on my list for future trips to the area. It's easy to understand why they've been open so long!

3rd time to Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant it's in Vegas Chinatown on the side of Spring Mtn Road.

We went after hiking one day so we got an early dinner and was starving.

Got:
Tom Ka Chicken soup - huge and pretty tasty
On Choy - salty, but we need veggies
Pork fried rice - B. picked it, tasted ok.
Green Curry pork dish - tasted ok, I think maybe came with side of steamed white rice.  Wish we'd known wouldn't have gotten fried rice.

Tasty and pretty cheap.

At my little hotel on the Strip (no longer Cosmopolitan, btw) we have an Employee Dining Room. It's... well... it would get zero stars on Yelp. So sometimes we just can't hack it, and call in for some more-edible options. One of those places is Kung Fu. It had some good reviews and a full menu online, so we gave it a try.

It's exceptionally pleasing! Of course, I had to go with Pineapple Fried Rice (my favorite!) and theirs comes in huge portions with chicken, pork, shrimp, and crab! What a catch! (You see what I did there?) My coworker went with the pad thai and she liked it.

The best part is that delivery is in pretty reasonable time, and they deliver anywhere to the strip. It's a pretty good option, especially if you just want to chill in your hotel room before going out.
Delicious food, great service and would definitely recommend the Mongolian Beef and Egg Fu Beef! Got pick-up and everything was project!!

They delivered the wrong food and when I called to tell them, they insisted it was what I ordered and hung up on me, repeatedly. I had to take a cab there to get my money back. Don't waste your money or time. They never refunded my money. Avoid this place at all cost!!!!!!

This is one the best restaurants ever!!! No only is the food good but the service is great! Staff is very polite and restaurant is very nice and clean! My favorite dish is the orange chicken! I definitely recommend this place to everyone!!!!

Delicious chinese and thai dishes at Kung Fu! And cheap! 

Came here for dinner with my girlfriend's and ordered pad-see-ew with beef, kung pao chicken, chicken curry, and combination fried rice. Everything was oh so yummay!!! Portion servings was just enough for us 6. Customer service was top-notch! And wait time for our food was not long at all! I didn't even get a chance to take pictures of the food because the girls were starving and dove in right away lol! Very impressed with the overall experience, definitely recommend! (:

SO and i hit for late lunch - we've eaten here ...at least 5 times - we focus on the thai food - they also have a nice lunch plate $5.55 - includes egg flower soup ( a little too thick ) a chicken wing, an egg roll ( ehhhh ) white or fried rice ...ok...and about 6 or so main entrees - i had the minced chicken w/ mint...tasty - overall a great deal at $5. 

SO had a spicy noodle soup ( rice noodles ) - it had some bite !!  spicy bbq pork salad....we always get this dish - decent chunks of pork, a lime/cilantro dressing, red onions, greens - a little spice but very refreshing !!

we like this place

The worst restaurant I've ever been to! The food was disgusting and the waitresses were rude af! Might I add we had about 10 ppls at our table & they kept giving us ONLY a few napkins at a time knowing we have a lot of people's at our table including Childrens  Never again !

Never got the food.   Ordered it, waited, and then got a phone call, the driver went to Westin and not the Westgate hotel.  According to the driver,  Westgate doesn't allow deliveries.  I explained I was in for the night and did not want to go down to lobby. 10 minutes later an Asian woman called upset an accused me of saying goes Westin and I needed to go downstairs and get my food.  I repeated my explanation...I'm in for the night.  She hung up on me.  This hotel is open, no one checking for a room key like at the Venetian.   I think they just did not want to deliver up to the room...

Very good lunch, service, and atmosphere. Thai food is one of my faves and this place was outstanding. Took my vegas buddy here while in town  and he was very happy with the quality and service. I'll make this a stop any time I'm in town .

Visiting Vegas and decided to try this spot ...service is great and their food was delicious!!! Came back 2nd night in a row for dinner. Had the War Wonton soup and chicken fried rice. ....Loved it!!!!

This was my first time here, we went to china town to celebrate Chinese New Year. 
I ordered the fried calamari which was lightly fried , was just perfect.
My main course was chicken panang with white rice, the spice level 2, not too spicy. The papaya salad is my favourite dish , it was fresh and a must to compliment any dish.
To complete I had the Thai ice tea. The portion size was enough for 2 people.
The food overall was delicious but the waiters made us wait like 20 minutes for our bill.

It was my first time here so my hopes were really high that their food will really be authentic thai cuisine and IT DIDNT DISAPPOINT! My taste buds rejoiced when I tasted their seafood fried rice. It made me remember the same thing we ate when we went to Chatuchak Market in Bangkok last year. Their chicken wings were so good for me that I wanted more. Though I only gave 4 stars coz I wasnt that satisfied with the pad thai. It tasted good but something was lacking nevertheless I still enjoyed it. I love thai food and I would still come back to Kung Fu when I crave for it. Plus they have good servers.

I have ordered from here multiple times and tonight because our door dash driver didn't show up "in time" they gave away our food. Not only did the woman answering the phone yell at me, she hung up on me. I am disgusted with this behavior. Do not order with more than an hour left. I will never order from here again.

This place was highly recommended and I was super excited to try it ! When I got there friendly greeting by the host but than when it came to the server; he got to our table gave us waters and didn't even ask if we wanted anything else to drink but automatically asked if we were ready to order our food . Excuse me first thank you for the water but shouldn't you ask if I want something else and than out of that time getting our drinks give us time to look at the menu. Than when we actually placed our order I understand that there specialty is tom yum soup so I understand they have a big batch ready to go; what i had ordered was tom yum, Mongolian beef and shrimp fried rice . So I understood the soup was coming out ahead of the rest but 20 mins ahead come one I didn't order much and I don't only want soup . Thru out those 20 mins of just having soup he did not once come once to ask if we were ok or if needed anything else and I observed around there was a big party 8-12 people who look to be enjoying there food and I seen when they brought there feast in and so I was ready for mine . Than when I finally became annoyed of just having soup 20 mins I finally decided to cancel the rest of my order. Than when the server asked why I stated that I didn't just want soup than he tried and justify by saying the soup always comes first which I told him yes the soup maybe ready before because you have a big batch but it's common curtesy you bring all food together just like they brought the huge party the soup with the rest of there food . My mom wasn't a big fan of the soup so when I said " ok wait for the rest of the food" and 20 mins passed and I was eating the soup by myself believe that ; that was not the lunch I wanted to have with my mom on our day off . Point being soup was a 2 1/2 out of 5 . & I will not be coming again and will not recommend.
100% traditional Bangkok style Thai food....consistently excellent...been coming here for years...only 4 stars because it has gotten EXPENSIVE!!!

Pretty good Thai food here.  I love Tofu but probably not order the tofu satay again, very little flavor.  The other things that we ordered were pretty good.  It felt pretty authentic.  The wait staff was not very friendly but the food arrived hot and fresh and that is good enough for me.

If you order papaya salad, watch out - it's VERY spicy hot, and they'd only tell you that there are 2 choices - mild and spicy.  We ordered "mild" which was sooooooo spicy hot that it brought tears to my eyes (plse note I can take spicy very well). I talked to the server, who then said "oh, you should have ordered a non-spicy one". And refused to take it back.

So they expect the customers to do their job???? What the heck are the customers supposed to know that they offer a non-spicy, in addition to "mild", and "spicy"???
The POOREST customer service we have ever seen!

Eat here at your own risk!
I stop here every time I go to Las Vegas. Best Thai around & consistent all the time.

My husband isn't the type who likes to try new places, but he has been a lot more open to the idea lately. I have been coming to Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant for years and love it, so I convinced my husband to try it out. He is a fan now!! Their Mongolian Beef is the best in town and their service is great. The prices are affordable and the food gets to the table within minutes of ordering.

I love this place. The food is amazing. I think this is my third review in two years and I only put one up if a place really impresses or is horrible. I live literally all the way across town nd would drive the 30 to 40 min to eat at this place anyday

This place is great! We always take out-of-towners here, and we get nothing but rave reviews from them as well. It is often requested that we return the next time they are in town. The service is friendly and usually prompt. The food comes out as it is prepared, so sometimes it's a little weird to get a dish every few minutes. But it always comes out fresh, hot and delicious. We haven't delved into the Thai side of the menu, but we can vouch for a number of dishes on the Chinese portion of the menu. The General Tso's Chicken is our favorite, as well as the Sesame Chicken, Mongolian Beef and the Combo Chow Mein. Parking is a pain, but worth the hassle!

This review is long overdue, but I really need to give this restaurant a superb rating, because it without a doubt was delicious.

I went to Las Vegas for the summer and ate at a restaurant every day for a week, but Kung Fu Thai and Chinese Restaurant was definitely my favorite. My uncle kept saying that Thai food is good, but I've never tried it and pushed to eat at other restaurants.

On our last night there, we tried this place. I was just FLOORED by how scrumptious each and everyone one of my bites of food were. The waiters provided EXCELLENT service and they were so kind! We went at night, so it was just our huge family of around 30 and another small family at a table near us.

Foods I ate:
-Tom Yum soup
-Seasoned fish (forgot what it was called, but I hate fish and this was one of the only times I enjoyed eating it!)
-MONGOLIAN BEEF *YES YES YES*

I forgot all of the other dishes, but I'm sure that they all had just the right seasoning, texture, and taste.

Definitely give this place a try if you're ever in the area!

Have some late night in Las Vegas yesterday.  Just a wonderful staff and excellent tasty dishes.  I ordered Beef fried rice, chow fun, tom yum, and other side dishes.  Would definitely come back here.

The Food is really good...lots and lots of choices on the menu.
Parking sucks though.  Wait staff....they work hard and hussle. Just be patient with them. Been here a few times but this last time during Christmas....it was a mad house everywhere.  So, Kung Fu was packed but they took care of everyone the best they could. 

Great job...great food.

DO NOT COME.TO THIS PLACE...EVER!!!!!!!!Very rude and unless you are Asian they could care less if you come to eat....I wanted to place a order to go....for 20mins all the waiters just looked at me never saying a word...I tried to flag a waiter and he would rather ignore me than take my.order....I mentioned how their service made me feel and the manager just says do.you want.to stay or go...then.says ok.bye....how rude!!!!!

If I could give them -10 stars I would.
We arrived at 2:35pm order from the happy hour(it's until 3pm) menu on 2:40, at 3:05 the server came back says that he can't serve lunch spacial anymore-AFTER 30 min that we are waiting!!!!!!thats their new trick!

So we order from the regular menu,the food came dry and I found 2 hairs in my Mongolian beef+it was so chewy like a rubber.
I used to come here a lot and that was my first time after 9 months. This place change and become with tricky services,low quality of food and not clean at all. 
Better for the health dep to test this place soon as they can!!

I have to come here every time I visit Vegas. It's off the strip, so if you're feeling lazy, they deliver right to your hotel! (with a $5 charge which is so worth it if you're hungover/tired/etc). They take about 45 minutes to an hour.

I always get the Tom Yum Shrimp. NO MATTER WHAT. and you can get the level of spice. I am a huge spicy food fan so I always get 7/10. 

The restaurant has many different dishes to choose from- thai and chinese. So you will get your fix if you're craving something savory. 

And of course you can't forget the fortune cookies they generously pack :)

What happened? I loved this place, but Monday I walked in and there was like 3 ppl in the whole place eating so not busy right, well me and my sister get seated and the guy throws the menus down, didn't even say hi and walks away. Well we usually know what we want so we sit there... And sit there and he never came back after 15 mins. Didn't ask if we wanted a drink or anything. So I gave it a few more mins and nothing. After 20 mins of sitting there I was pissed. So we walked out. The server was terrible. I loved Kung Fu but I won't go back. So disappointed, this place has great food but the server was not that good.

Delivery was fast thats the only reason for the 2 stars, food was about a 1.

Pad thai seemed like the noodles were cooked yesterday, the veggies seemed like most came from a can and what was fresh was brown and wilting, the soup seemed way to sour, like it was about to turn. What a waste of 30$$

1. service was quite slow for an asian place

2. flavors were dense (pad thai and pad see ew were okay. Tom Kha Coconut soup, ive had better. Combination FR and BBQ Chow Mein, i rather eat my parents)

3. water was refilled quite fast 

4. the name of the restaurant? kinda silly

5. thai dishes were better than their chinese dishes

6. menu was large enough to feed a whole country

7. lastly, a couple sitting to the right of us were singing to each other.. my group of 9 were disturbed
Terrible service! When we complained to the owner he apologized but that was not sufficient as we thought our service would improve....NOPE

BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE......Ok so this place is my favorite place to go for good Chinese food fix. Whenever I'm craving tum yum chicken soup spicy number 5 and chili mint chicken spicy number 10 with a side of half order of egg rolls. Absolutely delicious atleast until the day I picked up my food as a to go order. I live near red rock and I had to drive all the way across town for my Chinese food so you know it must be good. Anyway I picked up my order got back home, I went to taste my tum yum soup and it had a roach floating at the top of my soup. I could have died. I drive back across town and returned it to the restaurant, they told me that the cook must've thought it was garlic and accidentally put it in my soup.... Wow I wonder if this happens often??????  CHECK YOUR FOOD!!!!
Horrible service. Mismanaged, unapologetic and unprofessional. Do not expect a nice time.

It took awhile for the server to show up. Ordered the tom yum jumbo shrimp soup which was not bad. The Mongolian beef was not that good. It lacked flavor and just simply wasn't tasty. The orange chicken was fairly decent. Will likely not return to this place, given the dozens of better options around town for this type of food.

Came here with four people initially, and that number rotated from 5-6 people at a time. Honestly have never been served so quickly and efficiently especially for a large party. Our group was expecting the portions to be divided into really small bits but actually the food here is quite amazing and the staff is really quick without making anyone feel like they were being rushed at all. Friendly staff that even if they aren't able to greet you directly at the door, even when occupied they'll still greet you and be super attentive. I loved the Vegetable Pad Thai here but the real hero of the night was the egg drop soup as I've been feeling under the weather.

When you want that authentic Chinese & Thai food, there's no place in Vegas (well maybe a few) that can top this one. Excellent food, large selection on their menu and the service is excellent, see my pictures, that speaks louder than words!

10/10 would recommend. Came in for lunch and we were quickly seated. Everything was clean and staff was super friendly. Ordered panang chicken, Mongolian beef, and pad Thai. Everything tasted amazing and came out quickly and hot. Staff kept our drinks full and made sure we were satisfied. Good food, good service. If you're in the neighborhood definitely a place to stop by for lunch. Another larger group came in and they were super accommodating for them and got everything handled for them as well.
I used to work close to here and their lunch specials are amazing. So is their chicken pad Thai. I never would have gone here if a coworker hadn't told me about it.

You can't go wrong with their wanton soup, pork  fried rice, seafood chow mein, and Thai BBQ chicken! Well at least, that's according to my friends and I. :)

Went here late Friday night after having gone to First Friday at the Arts District. Been craving for some Chinese food so we originally planned of going to this Golden Flower in Henderson, but unfortunately it's closed when we arrived there. Since that was already past 930p, most of the Chinese buffets we know were already closed. So we had this genius idea of going back downtown until we brought ourselves to Chinatown. That was quite a drive I'll say so talk about starving. Lol

We basically just acted on impulse and eat wherever our eyes set on first. And this was it! We absolutely liked the food, the restau's ambiance, and its all-cool-and-smiling staff. :)

If you're around the area, you must try this dining place out sometime!

I've been going to this place for 16 years. The food is amazing, hasn't change over the years! The staff used to be better but still decent customer service(when it's not super busy, otherwise it's not great) The orange chicken is the best around. Prices are decent for the portion sizes. I bring friends and family(which are mainly from out of town) to this place and they love this place as well and come every time they are in town

The food is amazing. The drunken noodles are so good and the lemon and garlic chickens are delicious. The prices are reasonable as well. My only complaints are parking is difficult and takeout wasn't ready at quoted time.

This is my THAI go to spot!! We've been coming here for over 2 years and have never had a bad experience. Food is always delicious and fresh! We are regulars so the staff know what we want as soon as we walk in! 
Chicken Fried Rice, Tom Yum Chicken Soup ( no spicey) , and Kung pao Chicken all under $40 and it feeds 4 people. 
They also have a Coconut Tom Yum soup, I'm not a fan of it, but my friends love it! I wish they'd close later, being that they are in China town many places are open late, if wish they stayed open later! Definitely a place to check if your ever craving Thai!
Love love love this place!! I have been coming here for over 20 years. Always satisfied, great authentic Thai food, great customer service. Just the decor is dark and dated.

being that i am thai and have had thai food from many places in america and in thailand let me be the first one to say that this place could have possibly the best THAI FOOD in america that i have had...when i say best i mean authentic not that natalee thai crap or any of that stuff that is watered down and served to people who dont know anything about thai food...this place has a thai and chinese menu.....stick with the thai food here....

every time i set foot in las vegas eating here is a must...the food is made here the way it is supposed to be made...SIMPLY AMAZING!

If I could give this place zero stars I would. I rarely ever write reviews for any businesses but this restaurant stole my money and the money of two of my co-workers as well.

We decided to order three lunch specials online on their website and paid for it no problem via Paypal. We receive a phone call shortly after from a woman who refused to name herself and she stated that "Oh sorry we don't serve lunch specials on the weekends." We ask if she can make an exception and deliver our food because we already paid for it. 

"No, we can't make food for you. We don't serve lunch specials on the weekends."  

Then why is it available on your website? Why were we able to pay for it? Granted, we did not see the disclaimer on their website that said "Lunch Specials are only available M-F 11:00-3:00PM" --but then why is it available as an option to purchase on the website at all times? 

I also ask if there is any way we can just go pick up the food or if they can refund us our money. The woman says "No we can't make food for you." She then says "You'll get your money back when the manager comes back...but I don't know when he'll be back." Um? Excuse me?  I ask her when the manager will be back and she says that she doesn't know. I then ask her if there's anyone else we can speak to. She says no and that she is the only one in the restaurant. 

How is this poor disgrace of customer service the only one at this restaurant? There are no chefs to cook our food? Seriously? Maybe that's why we can't get our food.

We even offered to pay extra to get the regular entre portions of the food but she again repeats: "No food for you." She then states "Don't worry, don't worry! You'll get your refund. I'll let my manager know. Not sure how long refund take." How very reassuring. 

Shortly after speaking with me she hangs up after stating that "There is nothing I can do for you."  

Well, if there's nothing you can do, there's definitely things that I can do. The business is being reported to the Better Business Bureau and a dispute was also opened on Paypal for our refund. All we wanted was some damn food.

I have been here since 2004 like every year when I go to Vegas. It become family tradition to eat lunch next day when we got to Vegas. 
If you like Asian spices foo, my recommendation is

502
Beef jerky
Tomyang kon 
Egg fried rice
Papaya salad
Stair fried snow pea
550
579
Kung pao duck. 
Mongolian beef stair fry
590 cat fish

I work at a casino on the strip and this is the only place my co-workers and I could find that would deliver. The food is pretty good, there's no complaint there. The only complaint that I have is when we place an order over the phone. There are two people that we've noticed who take the orders, one is male the other is female. Every time we order from the male, the orders are always correct. When we order from the female, every time, the order is incorrect. Everytime. When we've called back to have them correct the mistake, she will sit there and argue with us. We've decided not to order from them again. Too bad. They've just lost steady business.

One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  Been coming here for more than 15 years.  Love the duck noodles!!
Best long island ice tea in Vegas!

Easy to find and clean. It's prob 5 min off the Strip. I ordered Chicken Satay and Pad See Ew which is a staple. It wasn't very busy when I arrived but by time I left had a line. Definitely a place I would visit again. I gave them 4 Chicken Satays...

Yes, this place is as good as it gets. All our friends come in from out of state and always want to come back to Kung Fu's for their wonderful food. Always a great food experience. The staff is exceptionally attentive. A must try!

My experience with Kung Fu Thai was very dissapointment.  I went there and signed my name on the waiting list.  They told us it would take about 10 minutes waiting time.  After about 20 minutes waiting, I went and check the list, my name was next to be call.  Out of a sudden a group of people walk in and they get seat right away.  I asked why is that and the server said that group have more people.  What the heck, they only have two more people than I am.  I got so mad and about to walk out.  Same thing happened again when a group of 10 people walk in and they get the table right away.  I looked around and it seem all the tables were full and it would take us another 30 minutes to wait.  I decided to try the Pho Saigon and we got seat right away.  I will never come back to Kung Fu Thai again.

Parking is a complete nightmare... 

We walked into an almost empty place, and were ignored.

After waiting for a human being to acknowledge us,
We were then seated at a filthy table. 
The top was sticky, and there was food all over the seat cushions... 
We flagged someone down, and they wiped it down.... Half @$$ed, that is. 
I say this because half of the booth still had food on it,
I love my husband, but we were sitting uncomfortably close to avoid sitting in someone else's dinner.

Their menu has 600 items...Ridiculous. 
it looked more like a Harry Potter novel then something that should have food items. 

Waited forever for a server to get us glasses of water, 
he dropped them off and then walked away, 
didn't even ask us if we wanted anything else to drink.

Tasted the water and walked out.

Won't be back.

Not impressed. I had the wor won ton soup and shrimp fried rice. Both had way too many onions.  Besides the taste of onion, the fried rice didn't really have much flavor. This was my first time here. I heard a lot of good things. And, most of the comments on Yelp were positive. The place was crowded with both people sitting and eating as well as people getting takeout. Service was good.  I'll try it again and see what happens.

This place was pretty good. Nice big portions and good customizability. We came with a big group and they let us split the check. They include graditutity for parties 6 or more. The Pad Thai had great flavor and if you want, you can add the spices on the side. I was a little drunk at the time of eating, so take that as you will.

This restaurant was recommended by a Vietnamese gal who worked in a nail salon...we wanted Chinese food so we tried it.  The food was great, service very good and a very ethnic feel to it...many Asians eating there so we felt that was a good recommendation too.  It was great and we'll go back.

Gave this place a second try, and it still failed. The server was unfriendly, and the service was both slow and ingenuine. The red curry was watery and lacked any taste, and the Ton Yum soup was beyond miserable. As for management presence? None. Will NEVER return....

Food was good but not happy with their service.  20%  Service charge for table of 5? Feel it was dishonest on their part because it was all written in their native language.  We almost give them tips until we asked them to about the extra charge.  Always read over the orders and don't be in a hurry to get out.
Delicious food! Good service Even when u take out the food is fresh and hot. Thank you Kung fu

This place was amazing in many ways. The food was fabulous. We came on a Saturday night and they accommodated our large party of 14. They sat us in a matter of minutes. The wait staff was very attentive and kept the soft drinks full. We had many kids in the party that enjoyed the food to. Very kid friendly. The menu had many options even for vegetarians.
The food here is really great... if you like authentic Thai food!!!  Suggestions include... Mint Chicken (Chopped Chicken Chili Mint), Shrimp Pad Thai, Tom Kha Ghai Soup, Beef Satay.

The service was incredibly slow. 3 tables around us had to ask for someone to take their order. The soup was lukewarm and not much in it the food was tasteless. Had to repeatedly ask for things to be brought to our table not worth the money we will never go there again
They weren't very good 1-1/2yrs ago when I visited Vegas and ate there but maybe better now.

I was surprised to see all the negative reviews here! My husband and I dined here after we discovered Lotus of Siam was closed between 2:30 and 5:30pm. We ordered Crab Rangoon/Wontons, Mongolian Beef and Shrimp Pad Thai between the two of us. They also serve a small selection of alcoholic beverages.

Our food was amazing! And the service was fast. I did have to point out to our waiter which white wine I wanted on the menu so maybe communicating your food order over the phone could be tricky. But the fact that they offer online ordering should resolve this problem. AND, do you want authentic or not?! The hostess and our waiter were very pleasant and professional. 

Lastly, we saved a lot of money getting off the strip. We will definitely return!

family friendly. accommodated every size of family. nostalgic food and comforting atmosphere. taking a bite of the pork jerky felt like your grandmother hand feeding you your favorite meal as a child. her blowing on it before every bite, and preparing more after every bite. it was a picture perfect family meal, the meal just didn't stay on the plate long enough for me to take a picture

The food was absolutely delicious.  Even the option to have either shrimp fried rice or jumbo shrimp fried rice was a nice touch. The seafood soup with calamari, fish balls, shrimp and crab was amazing! Their fried shrimp and fried calamari wasn't the average... it truly was amazing. But the part was the customer service... I am truly one who is big on great customer service... and this place truly knows how to treat their customers.
Always great experience great food friendly staff. Conveniently near the strip for those who are visiting and love Thai food
Some of the best Thai food in town. Service is friendly, however; does not qualify for speedy. Worth the trip to Chinatown-great Tom Yum!

I will start saying the restaurant is clean. We were seated right away and our server was prompt to come to our table.. Order was right on point delicious& fresh. The owner even step out from the kitchen and came to our table to greet us. While we waited for our food she share how long her restaurant had been in business. Interesting lady. Overall I highly recommend this place whenever your in town. Hubby and I like to expire the local restaurant whenever we are in town.  

Place got super busy right before we finish our food
Bad service ...I placed a order they gave it to a bigger party ....the manager said sorry ....I order once more from them so it happen again .....

Another China town local hot spot! I've gone here several times now and have always had a positive experience. The people who work here are not only friendly but usually quick about coming back to the table to check on you or clear plates. I've also never had to wait and the ambiance is a little more intimate than some of the other places nearby, such as Pho Kim Long (not that I have anything against that place). 

As for the food, the portions are usually pretty big so I always recommend getting a few things and sharing "family style." One of my favorite dishes is the Chicken Satay. The sauce has a sweet flavor as well as the cucumber salad that comes with it. Delicious! Don't worry, if you aren't a fan of sweets or are trying to eat healthy they have plenty of tasty options such as a big plate of steamed vegetables! The menu is huge so there's definitely an option for everyone. Enjoy!
The best Pa Nang Chicken Curry ive ever had!!! Off the strip, cheap, and amazing food.
Sooo good. I ordered delivery and they were at my room within 35mins. I ordered orange chicken and vegetable fried rice. Both were excellent. I will eat here every time I am in Vegas!

Second time here, food came out very fast on a Saturday afternoon lunch time, pretty dang tasty overall, had a Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, Mongolian beef, chicken pad Thai. We ordered everything spicy, yet still wanted more heat! If you like your Thai dishes spicy, order it at an 11 (out of 10). Maybe you'll get lucky and get that heat we missed out on.

They have pretty long vegetarian menu.
I lie them, very good service and food :)
Ami is very nice server.
The restaurant look expensive but is very good prices.
Thank you...
Awesome food. Will go back when back in Vegas. Must try their tom yum soup!!! I really enjoyed it and my husband who loved tom yum thought it was one of the best!

This place is awesome!! The food is amazing and the wait was very short!
I highly recommend the Combination Appetizer and the Egg Flower Soup:)

I was here a few days ago and I shared five dishes, and only one of the dishes disappointed me.  It was the "orange chicken".  The orange chicken was heavily battered and there was very little orange glaze on it.  So if I were you, I would avoid the orange chicken at all costs!

By FAR my favorite Thai restaurant. 
If you love beef, I suggest ordering and trying out the Mongolian Beef.

It was a long evening and a few of us were starving! We were very glad that this place has late hours and there were SO MANY items to choose from on the menu. The best part was that the tom ka soup came flaming so it was kept warm while we were eating. Service was fast, portions were huge - the deliciousness went on for another meal!

We got sat down right away and place an order for 6 entree.  3 came out within 15 minutes, next 2 was 20 minutes after and my husband dish came out last (20 additional minutes) and it was wrong.  We informed the waiter and they told us that is the way they cook general chicken.  It had pineapple and tasted like sweet n sour chicken.  I have never been to a place that puts pineapple in the general chicken!   To top it off, there was a group of 15 folks standing around our table just waiting for tables to be cleared to be sitted. (Half of their crowd were sitted and the other half waiting).   It was dis-organized and other table was getting upset as well.  One table found a roach crawling on the table and yelled it out.  We were very irratated and asked for a check.  My husband didn't get to eat at all and nor did the waiter got us any refill on our drink.  Food was not authentic at all (yes I'm Asian), poor service, and very dis organized! I travel around the world just to try different Thai restaurant and this is not one to ever recommend or return too.  Best authentic this food in Vegas is by far Lotus of Siem!!

When I first saw the location I didn't think I'd like it, or the service would be that great, but everyone was friendly, fast, attentive to our beverages.

The food was pretty good, we asked for a mild on the coconut curry, it was slightly spicier than mild, but still yummy.

The area was clean, service fairly quick, good food.
Always get the Mongolian beef spicy #7. You tend to get better service if you have someone asian in your group.
Haven't been here much since they remodeled which is quite awhile ago but will probably try again soon. Was a great place to get both Thai and Chinese food.

Food is inconsistent. Staff is rude on the phone. Food comes cold so we called to speak with the manager and the lady talks back to us. And we get put on hold for another 20 min. Then the manager actually asks if we want another one. Really?? Um, yes that would help. Then we wait another 30 min. Rediculous!!

Located in Chinatown in Las Vegas in a little strip mall. My family always makes a stop here on our annual Christmas Vegas trip before we feast on buffets after buffets. The food is okay.. they have a lot of options for family style. We always order well over 10 dishes since we come in a big group, which gives us a lot of variety. Some items worth trying are the beef salad, chicken larb, spicy cat fish, and minced chicken.

After the high  reviews, we decided to eat at this restaurant. We were seated pretty quickly and the atmosphere seemed nice, which led us up to high expectations. After waiting for ten minutes to get our drink order taken, we were greeted by the rudest server ever. He kept getting our order wrong and had to repeat several times. Two of our plates  came out in a timely fashion, but we waited for all plates to come out so we could all eat together. Not an unreasonable request. 30 minutes of waiting for the rest of our order and our waiter hadnt even come to check on us. There had been 3 parties seated and served in the time that we were waiting. After 45 minutes of waiting for the other 4 plates, we asked the  waiter if we could just pay for our drinks because we weren't  going to pay for food we hadnt receieved. Somehow they magically had two more of our plates ready as we were standing up to walk out.  The waiter first tried to ignore our request, then hid in the kitchen. We were very calm in out request and just kept getting blown off. A lady came out of the kitchen and shook her hand at us as to dismiss us. Thats when our waiter came out with our checks for our drinks. 

We paid for our drinks and left. 

As you can imagine, we wont be returning. What a disappointment!
Ordered orange chicken. Didn't like it and asked to have it shipped. They wouldn't let me change my order but they were okay with taking the dish away. So I sat and watched a friend eat. Lol.

Very disappointing.  This restaurant's Thai food was excellent four years ago, but has been going down steadily since then.  Now much of their Thai food tastes like bad Chinese food.  (I've traveled extensively in both countries, and I know the difference.)

Today their Thai seafood mint combo was barely edible, and their Thai mixed vegetables was hardly better.  Noodle salad was only average.  My wife, who is Chinese, said the Thai food tasted like bad Americanized Chinese food - so salty she had to eat it with a lot of rice and three glasses of water (which saltiness is not typical of true authentic Thai).

It's a shame this formerly excellent restaurant has careened downhill.
Went here because Krung Siam across street was closed. Should have kept driving... bad bad bad.
I enjoyed the presentation of the soup and the dishes were well portioned. The aesthetic is really authentic and the servers are attentive. I think i have a new favorite Thai place in town.
Worst service I wouldn't even give it one star it used to be the best place but I won't be a regular customer anymore

I normally come here for Thai...but this was on Sunday, service was slow, and the food was only OK.  I got shrimp chow mein...noodles were thicker than normal. I was kinda disappointed, but I will be back.
Could not get service. Waited over 20 minutes and no waitstaff came to the table. People who just were sat after us were being served. So we left and will never return.

I've seen a lot of reviews here... Complaining about the service... I think most of you need to chill a bit... Could the service be a tad better... Yeah it could... But the food totally makes up for it... English is a slight problem for some of the Workers... But it's a Chinese restaurant... Duh... Please don't listen to these negative reviews... You Only will be missing a great dining experience.... Huge menu even better preparation... My only complaint is I ate too much.... I usually bring food home... But the flavors were unique and wonderful.... Can't wait to go back.... It will be a while since I live in Los Angeles.... This place would do great there...

Always a good bet to come here if you're in the mood for reasonably priced Thai or Chinese food. Everything in the menu is delicious. I really recommend the 'beef jerky'. The place is consistently busy, which is always good sign.

Very decent Chinese buffet.

Kung Fu gets praise as a decent and affordable Chinese food buffet offering.

There really isn't anything that was truly amazing here but in this place's defense, everything was consistently good.  Not amazing, just good.

A lot of solid expected sightings like lo mein noodles, sweet and sour pork, kung pao chicken, & eggrolls.

Again, nothing that I had was amazing but I was very pleased with the more than acceptable quality of the items available.  Nothing seemed to be sitting for long periods of time and all of the foods were being served at the appropriate temperature.

Overall: Decent offering of Chinese buffet food at affordable prices.  Great place to stuff your face full of okay food.  Thumbs up for not making me feel like puking afterwards as most low end Chinese buffets do.

By far the best Thai food I have EVER had.
