Best thai food ever!!! OMG....ive been craving this place ever since I left!  Pad Thai, Pad See-Ew, Garlic Pepper Pork, Fried Rice, everything is amazing!!!  Service is not so great, but that disappears when you taste their food!  I will definitely return here every time i come back to vegas!!! :D
Authentic Thai food. Delicious and great customer service. The place is large but get very crowded during normal lunch and dinner hour. Prepare to wait for a table but it's worth the wait.
First time eating here and will definitely order again. Fast delivery and the sweet and sour jumbo shrimp was very delicious! 5 stars!
Great prices. Pad thai so-so pineapple fried rice amazing

The worst service ever. Waiter started arguing with me after he brought the wrong soup and told me that I got what I ordered. Then he just walked away. Then he came back telling me again that this I what I ordered, this time he took the soup and walked away telling me of in Chinese. Another waiter came to our table and recognized me from his prior restaurant and says hi and that he wanted to apologize for for his behavior. The new waiter even remembered what I use to ordered at his restaurant. He brought me my favorite soup and told me about Thor curries and that next time we come in to order the green curry, because it is the same as the one I use to order at his old restaurant. Food is mediocre and the service is horrible. Don't know if I will be back ever.

OMG.... awesome food and cheap prices. Worth the trip from the Strip. We ate there three times in a row for dinner, yup, three on our honeymoon. We had different food every night, and everything that we had was delicious. The tofu appetizer was the only thing that we ordered twice. The people there were friendly and the service was fast even when they were busy, and it has a really homey feel to it that makes you comfortable. If I were a local, I would eat there again and again.

As I walked into a surprisingly full dining room of a Thai restaurant in a town well-known for Thai food, I built up expectations of a great meal. I didn't get one.

Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant was actually an impromptu plan B. We wanted to go to another Thai restaurant on the other end of this extremely long and narrow strip mall on Spring Mountain. However, this came with a personal recommendation, so it seemed viable at least. Entering the Valley View-facing front door of this business and seeing the packed house, it was natural to hope for something special.

It took around 10 minutes to be seated during this dinner rush - and a manager or employee claimed that this was actually a slow night. Speaking of slow, they took a while to get around to taking our order. That wasn't so bad for a first-timer trying to decide on what to choose from the vast menu of at least a hundred items. Thankfully, they did get our food out in a reasonable amount of time.

Papaya Salad ($8.95): julienned papaya, sweet coconut sauce, ground peanuts, ground dried shrimp, tomato, and evidently some chilis. All of the ingredients were fresh, especially the crunchy papaya. The spiciness was quite problematic, though. I called for a 3 out of 10 but variance was huge. I took several bites with no lingering heat at the start, but some later bites incinerated my mouth. It averaged out to at least a 5.

Pad Thai w/ "Certified Angus Beef" ($10.25): the beef is at best a little above average, but I don't have any beef with the marketing ploy. The problem is that the Pad Thai tasted like a Chinese bastardization of this fundamental, foundational noodle dish. I didn't taste such key nuances as fish sauce and tamarind. The end result was on the sweet side and was enjoyable enough, but it wasn't Pad Thai.

Green Curry w/ pork ($9.95): I didn't have as much of an issue here as my dining companion did. It was a solid curry with bamboo shoots and zucchini, and a side of white rice. The only noticeable downside is perhaps the unremarkable pork. I was also curious as to the lack of yellow and red curries on the menu, and considering the inauthentic dish above, I'd wager that they just don't have that depth of recipe knowledge in their kitchen.

I don't see what draws the crowds to Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant. They simply don't hold to candle to other local Thai restaurants both inexpensive and extravagant. Maybe it's their close-to-Strip location, along with their sign perfectly positioned to catch the eye of those driving down Spring Mountain. Maybe it's their decades of presence and the loyal if misguided long-time patrons - surely, fewer options were available way back when. As for me, one try was enough.

We used to go here almost 20 years ago.  We came back to have a meal with the family.  It was absolutely delicious.  We ordered the Wor wonton soup, Mongolian beef, General Tso's chicken, and shrimp lo mein.  The flavors of the dishes were great and the plates were not heavily sauced (a personal complaint I have of most Chinese dishes).  It was pretty busy for a Sunday late dinner crowd, but we were served quickly and the staff was very friendly.  My only complaint was the barbeque pork in the wonton soup has the orange rind and it maid the soup look pinkish (it made it look unappetizing).  Besides that one complaint we loved coming here again after a long absence and will come here again for Chinese/Thai food!!!
Had the pad see ew and chicken panang. Everything came out fast, great service and very tasty. Highly recommend! The chicken panang was more peanut-y than I'm used to and I liked it!
Excellent food and service! No wait, popular spot! Great atmosphere. Thoroughly enjoyed myself and my husband loved the combination fried rice with crab.

Stopped for a light lunch while picking up my truck from the shop.  Had tom kha kai and eggrolls.  Really nice to have a place where you can get good fresh-made eggrolls. I ordered the soup with "medium" heat, and the heat level was fine.  Good amount of chicken meat, and the herbs and vegetables were all fresh.

We were very happy with our take-out from Kung Fu: Chicken with cashews, Pad Thai Chicken and Chicken Rice Soup.  This is convenient to the Rio Casino and there is parking so you can run in and pick up carry out.  I would go back.

I love coming here! Been here many times. This is where I come for my Thai/Chinese fix!

The restaurant is on the corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View Blvd. You'll find parking in the strip plaza. It does get busy though!

It's very nicely decorated inside. There is plenty of seating, the booths are pretty big but if you need something for a larger party then there are plenty of tables to go around.

Restrooms are typically ok.

There is a full bar but I have never really seen too many people sit there.

FREE Wi-Fi.

Customer service is usually fast and efficient. The waiters are very friendly and knowledgable when you ask a question about the menu or a dish.

The food is to die for! Always fresh and hot when it comes out. My favorite dish is the Mongolian Beef/ Chicken. It's topped with some fried noodles that totally make the dish! My husband likes many of the dishes so he does not have one is particular. We usually get an order of potstickers but they are deep fried and are too crunchy for my tastes.

Give this place a try! You will get hooked!

Not sure what those who gave this place more stars ate but their food was way below mediocre. I tried the Pad Thai and Garlic Chicken with rice and didnt like either. Both lacked flavor and tasted like Rubber. Not sure what the environment in there is like as i ordered in. Definitely not ordering/going there again.

Ordered from this place based on recommendation from the front desk at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club. Delivery charge was only $4.00 which beats taking a cab ride to and from the hotel.  We looked at the website and ordered most of the favorites.  We liked the Tom Kha soup, Fried Chicken WIngs and the Chicken Chowmein.  They all tasted good and authentic. We didn't care for the Wonton soup, Mongolian Beef, Eggrolls or Pad Thai.  The Pad Thai was very average and noodles were clumped up together. The Steamed Vegatables with dipping sauce was ok and there was about 8 different vegetables in it.  I would definitely order from here again picking the right dishes.
Food was excellent and the delivery was fast.  Definitely will order again.  If you like Chinese food this is the place to get it from.  The reviews on the general chicken were spot on.

One of my favorite places for Thai food. Prices are reasonable, and the food is great! The restaurant is medium sized, and I haven't had to wait to be seated for a table yet. The servers have always been very helpful and attentive when I've come. 

They have my favorite panang curry (10/10 spicy oh yes!) and pad see ew (beef or tofu). My friends say that they have the best Thai Iced Tea here, too.

The food itself is good (or at least what I ate, the pad see eaw), but I've got to say that the service here is one of the most terrible out of everywhere I've ever been...and that's saying something! The food would get a four star, service would get one star..and I'm ALL about service. Anyway the attitude of the waitstaff is "I don't care"..they're the type that are only attentive if they feel like it, and if they're not they don't care about apologizing. Kinda like when you're in the checkout line at a store and you tell the cashier you've been waiting for a long time and she ignores your statement completely, rings you up, and sends you on your way. Thats the attitude here. Maybe its because they know they're in a good location, so business will come regardless of a few unhappy people. If you tell them they have horrible service they'll literally respond "I don't care, we don't want you back anyway"...then when YOU start to have an attitude one of them will follow you out the restaurant and scream "Don't come back okay!!"......thats right, I definitely won't!

One day, my wife and I were out, and she told me we should go to this place. She said she had been there seven years ago, and it was very good. 

I told her that " a lot can change in seven years", and I was right. 

We both agreed that this was one of the worst Chinese meals we ever had.

The staff did try to please, but they just could not over come the bad food that came out of the kitchen. We ordered a curry dish, kung pao chicken, and a shrimp dish.

My wife took one look at the curry dish and said, "When I saw it, I knew we were in trouble."  She was right. Poor quality ingredients, and no taste to it.

The Kung Pao Chicken, a standard which I use to compare Chinese places, was awful. My dogs turned down the left over chicken; The peanuts were few, and tasted like they were purchased from a ball park, six months after the season ended, and the dish tasted liked it was cooked in Motor oil.

Remember those terrible shrimp that are in those 99 cent cocktails in Downtown Casinos? Ever wonder where the ones they reject go? This is the place!!

Top off the food with booths where the fabric is torn apart and needs replacement, and you risk sitting with a spring up your butt, and you have a perfect picture of 
Kung Fu Thai and Chinese. 

Go across the Street to Krung Thai. Better food, nicer place, better prices, and much easier to park.

Trust me, I wanted to give this a Zero, but I am required to give one star. Generous.
this place has my favorite panang anywhere. The Thai coffee and sticky rice is good too!

Food is good, portions are little, word of advice if you are going in a party of 4 or more ordering entrees each be direct and tell them you want your own rice in its own bowl. They will charge for extras and give you less rice altogether in a bigger bowl. Each entre comes with 1 cup of rice and charges for more if asked. Rice isn't that much more but $1.50 per extra cup but if you were to get your 1 cup in the first place you most likely wouldn't need a second cup. Overall food is ok.

I would rate this as a solid 3 1/2 Stars. The food is good, I just expected better (considering it is located in Chinatown). We ordered the barbecued pork as an appetizer, and shrimp with lobster sauce, General Tso's chicken, and Mongolian beef, as the entree's. Barbecued pork was tender and tasty. General Tso's chicken was cooked properly (crisp on the outside, tender on the inside), but tasted more like sweet and sour chicken (as it did not have the usually red hot peppers, so it was not spicy at all). The shrimp and lobster sauce was good, although the shrimp could have been a little larger and the removal of the tails would have been better. The Mongolian beef was also good, but many places in Vegas/Henderson make Mongolian beef as good (or better). I have eaten in some geat Chinese restaurants in New York, and China, so take that into consideration in reading my review (as my expectations are high). I think overall, most people will enjoy their meal at Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant.

Ordered $60 in food online for delivery and was called 15 minutes later and told it was too far.  They said they only deliver 3 miles out and I'm 5.  The website says it will not allow the order if they won't service your zip code and it had no problem accepting the order.  I'm a little disappointed that I didn't get the opportunity to try this place, the food looked good but got bit by their broken website and/or unwritten policy.

Me and my husband ate here today for their lunch specials.
Their chopped chicken with mint wasn't good and the texture was overcooked, so I called and talked to the server and asked if my husband can change it.she was gone for a minute and came back saying " we cannot change it coz he already touched the food"
We were like thats the point because the food was garbage!
This restaurant has bad service, bad food and the restaurant smelled bad too.
We are never ever coming back here
Best general tsos chicken ive ever had. Service was good. My drink was refilled when i needed it to be. Couldnt ask for much more. Definitely visit this place if you want great chinese food
Excellent Thai and Chinese food. I've gone here with friends, family, and business associates. Great for all three. Try the beef pepper steak or the chicken fried rice: It's bomb!!!!!

Very good food and very good service. For a moment I thought I was back in China in Thailand. If you have flown 15,000 miles from Asia to get to Las Vegas you definitely need to come here and pretend you are still in Asia. Enjoy!

Girlfriend and I decided to dine in since the Vietnamese place within the plaza was sporting an hour long wait, we might as well have just waited. 

We enter and it's pretty busy, but no line at the door so it seemed like we were going to get decent service.

Damn man. We got seated and we were promptly brought water however we waited about fifteen minutes for someone to come by to take our drink and food order. After about twenty, a server finally came over and took everything at once. 

After another fifteen minutes, still no drinks so I got up and asked where they were, and as soon as she brought the food is when we got our drinks. The food was decent, however we had to get up, travel to a dirty table, and get our own soy sauce. Also the portions were pretty small. I ordered the general tso chicken and she had the bbq pork wonton soup.

The food like I said, was decent. It's just the service was so awful I couldn't take it, I honestly considered just walking out. There were only about 4 servers on the floor and obviously they were very overwhelmed. The bussers were amazing though, they really hustled their asses off. 

Next time hopefully the management staffs up for higher volume because I know this place has been in business for a long time and has great potential. Perhaps on a slower day we will check them out again if we are in the area.

Being new to Las Vegas, the search is on for certain restaurants that are "musts" while I'm here. 
A good Chinese joint is crtical, and the mission has been accomplished.
They've got a very good lunch special for $5.55 (described above). 
I recommend the BBQ Pork Appetizer. It's a little different than I've had before, coming covered with a honey sauce, but it's very good.
Sweet & Sour Chicken is good, fried rice is solid. It's going to be a weekly stop for me.

A cornerstone of Chinatown in Las #Vegas Kung Fu Plaza ofers a chinese/thai menu with delivery offered in the nearby vicinity.

NOT a big fan of asian cuisine since its all rice,noodles and strange meats I tend to stay away but I played it safe with an appetizer combo,BBQ Pork fried rice and wor wonton  soup. Delivered to my door in 25 minutes for under $30!!

The fried rice was good but nothing special-very little pork and the rice was just ok. NO crunchy noodles for the Wor WonTon Soup when I requested them was a big downer:( The soup was really good however.

The appetizers were ok I could have ordered a dozen of the wings and been better off however!! The other stuff was forgettable even looking at the photo I cant rememeber what it was:(

Alot better places to try in Chinatown but you live you learn.

Where do i begin with this place.....i usually critique the food and the food only, despite the bad service im rating this place completely on the food alone. I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with fried rice for $6.75 And an appetizer sampler. First of all the "chicken" was heavily battered. upon further investigation ( me taking apart the breading ) i realized that the chicken is not breaded in house. Its the cheapest mechanically separated frozen garbage ive ever seen. This meal was worse then the chinese food station at the palace station buffet. With an overly sweet sauce dedicated to hiding the "flavor" of this so called version of meat. I was truly disappointed. I envision an owner that cares more about food cost percentages then he does about the quality of the food. Batter your own chicken! Chicken is cheap. Very disappointed! Will never visit this establishment again

Service was bad, and one of the dishes, Pineapple Fried Rice, was horrible.  Their Thai BBQ chicken was on the dry side.  The flat noodles, that they use for Pad See Ew, were on the thick thick side.  

The Pineapple Fried Rice was just soggy.  It didn't even seem that it was fried because of all the water or stock they added.  It was almost to the verge of porridge territory.

I was surprised at the prices too, about $10 a dish, for the quality and quantity they serve (meaning small portion).

Their menu is extensive. They specialize in Thai, and Chinese food.

I would rather go to the strip and pay and eat Americanized Chinese food.

I'm Thai & I have no idea what Kung Fu has to do with Thai. Kung Fu is clearly Chinese so as for the name of the restaurant it should be Thai & Kung Fu Chinese Restaurant. 

Thai Food: 3/5 It was okay not much to rage about. I ordered a yellow chicken curry. Usually curry comes in a semi-thick sauce but they was plan soupy. The rice we ordered for our curry ended up being over cooked and dry. Even though the curry sauce wasn't as thick as I'm used to it was still delicious. Not as spicy as I wanted it but It was an "Americanized 10" not Thai 10 on the scale of spicy. 

Chinese Food: 2/5  I'm not much of a Chinese food eater because I've noticed a lot of Chinese dishes are super oil and greasy. BUT We ordered some kind of stir fried Mongolian Beef dish. It was definitely a Chinese dish because the sauce was oily you could see the oil bubbles. 

Service: 3/5 The service was good even during busy hours. The place was a bit of mess though. There was rice and pea's ever where, but I just brushed it off because there were children running around. This place seems family ordinate but it was also loud.

We ordered for delivery online which was very convenient.  We were all pleased and happy with our meal.  There was more than enough food.  The food came within an hour.  I highly recommend this restaurant!!!
First timer. It was good compared to China a go go. Fresh food but pricey for the portions. Loved the Chicken Laarb, Tom yum soup and definitely recommend the sweet n sour pork!
The food was extremely decent for the price.   We ordered numerous dishes and everyone seemed to enjoy them.

We went to our favorite restaurant in China town in honor of the Chinese New Year celebrations going on downtown over the weekend. I have to admit, I was disappointed that there wasn't a special offered or some type of unique meal for the occasion. But none the less, we all decided to try something different than our "norm" on this trip and it was Tom Yum Soup with Shrimp - we've always seen and admired it at other people's tables, so decided to give it a try. On the scale of spice, we asked for medium. I'm not much of a spicy person - medium turned out to be way too much for both my mother and I. In fact, my sister, who loves spice, tried it and it was way too much for her. It ended up ruining our dinner this night. My lips were numb from my small sampling of it and I couldn't taste anything more the rest of the night.

We were surprised that it wasn't crowded when we arrived, however, by the time we left almost every table was filled. Although I've given the restaurant four stars, this night didn't really deserve a one star. It took 30 minutes for someone to take our order. Others arrived after us, received their food before us and were on their way out the door as we were finally being served our main course. For me - this is an automatic negative review for me unless circumstances occurred causing the delay. But this was before the place got really busy. It took another 30 minutes after we were done to have our table cleared and ask for the bill. And another 15-20 minutes after receiving the bill to flag someone down to take our payment. I think we only saw our waiter once the entire night. The rest of the servers were people we had to flag down for one reason or another. 

Although the soup ended up ruining the rest of the meal, I can tell you the food there has always been wonderful! Appetizers of Crab Rangoon, Calamari, Wings (really good), Satay and combo platters have always been tasty. We make it a must to have at least one appetizer each time we go. The Pad Thai is really good - they even give you a choice of the type of noodles to have with it. Mongolian Beef is awesome! So is the Ginger and Pepper Pork/Chicken or Beef (we've had one of each). Egg Fu Young (whichever type you have) is moist, delicious and so flavorful. Overall - we really love the restaurant. Just wasn't at its best this past Saturday evening.

Came here for lunch because of all the great reviews.... Had the lunch special sweet and sour chicken.  This is something that's pretty easy and I figured it would be a safe bet my first time here. The sweet and sour sauce is orange not pink or red and tasted terrible. It was like honey. The breading on the chicken was super thick and hard crunchy.  The only thing that was good was the spring roll but even then it was mired by the gross sauce... So was ok no  veggies at all in it but it was OK.  I wanted to ask them to bring something else but had a feeling it would have been like pulling teeth so i sucked it up and worked on my plate as i was really hungry... Not a great first experience.

I have eaten here twice when I have been visiting Vegas.  Both times I've had the panang curry.  It was very good both times.  My service has always been good and I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas and looking for Thai.

This is our second trip to Las Vegas in the last two weeks, and our second trip to to the restaurant. We were actually looking forward to coming back here this week when we found out we had to make a return trip up here so soon. The Thai food here is absolutely wonderful! The staff is kind and the food is served pretty quickly and is just so satisfying. I'm sure this will be a regular stop for us every time we are in town.

There was a little mom and pop Thai restaurant in my hometown of Houston that had the absolute best Pad Thai Chicken. They closed a couple of years ago and I have been on the hunt ever since for that same experience. I have found it here! And when I ask for extra spicy they never disappoint. A good compliment is the Hot and Sour Tofu soup. I have tried a couple of other dishes as has my wife and they are all good. A must if you love Thai food.

Kung Fu Thai was a little hard for me to find because it's tucked on the side of a shopping center. I thought there would be parking on the side . It is best to just park in the front of the shopping center and walk to the restaurant. We were seated right away which was nice. 

I ordered Drunken Noodles it's called something else here. I just can't remember what they called it! I'm glad the waiter knew what I was talking about! It was delicious!   My brother had the Sweet and Sour Pork ($8.75). You could tell that this was made fresh because it wasn't Chewy and soft. It was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. We also ordered a side of egg rolls for ($6.95) . I liked that the rolls had clear noodles in it because I don't see that often. 

The service was also prompt and friendly. We didn't have to look for anyone because they constantly checked on us. This was an awesome eating experience!

Met a co-worker here for dinner one night to grab some grub. My first time coming here to this place even though its been here for years (20+?). I don't know why they have like over 500+ items on the menu but if it works for them. We stuck with some basic Thai items and avoided the Chinese side of the menu. For starters we got a chicken larrb salad, then Beef pad sieew (Beef Chow Fun) and chili mint beef. Everything was very flavorful and delicious. I also happen to see a guy I went to high school with who is now a drummer in a famous band, but that's another story.
Another tasty place for Thai food.

We ordered at this place to try it out since we don't really know much Chinese places here that deliver and with us being new to the area, we wanted to give things a shot. We ordered our food about 9 and got the receipt confirming and wanted to call when we haven't gotten our food. It's been an hour and a half and we started getting worried. I had to call 3 times for someone to even answer and when someone did, the lady over the phone said "it hasn't been an hour. It's on its way. Bye" and she hung up the phone. So never again. I wouldn't recommend to  anyone. Terrible customer service.

Called to order delivery.  Took twice as long to deliver as they said it would.  Food was not even lukewarm.  Food was unrecognizable as traditional Chinese food.  Noodles were oily and had no flavor, nor did any of the food for that matter.   The food was not edible at all, very disappointing.

Service effing SUCKS!!! My husband and I were seated, given water, menus and plates then ignored for 20 MINUTES!!! We walked out and went somewhere else. We were very excited to try this place due to all the good reviews, but I will make sure to never recommend this place to anyone.

Been ordering from
This place since they opened and they have been going downhill over the years. Tonight they lost us. Waited over 25 minutes for potstickers. Knowing that service in Chinatown sucks we order a beer and chatted. Pot stickers came out steamed. Waited another 10 minutes for the 1 server on the floor to notice me waiving my hand. Nightmare. Comes over and started yelling that we ordered steamed. Never order steamed potstickers in my life but then again what server yells at you that you did. And no offense but with their language barrier how am I the one that is mistaken??? Went to walk out and he said "beer is $8.25" which we didn't even finish. So many good options have opened in Chinatown over the last 20 plus years. Save your money. These people suck and I will never step foot in their restaurant again. Yelp should let you give 0 stars.
Pad see ew was good. Pad thai was not that good, but the mango sticky rice was good, but small. Price is decent. Probbaly woild not come back

Since I discovered the restaurant (2 years now)  I ate there or ordered to-go at least once a week. Most of the guys basically know me by my name already. 

If you like soups, you should try the Tom-Yum Soup, though I never go higher than number 3-4, I guess at 8 it should be really spicy!

For delivery, our whole office loves the Mongolian Beef or Chicken, and also the Chopped Chicken Ya Kee Mao is one of my fav's.

The prices are really good, their lunch special comes for $6.50 with one egg roll and one chicken piece.

I would recommend it to most of Thai lovers...
Good food but the service is really bad when they are busy, ordered? spring rolls for appetizer and never came out. This is my 4th time here and not coming back. Taking my business somewhere else

We needed a fast dinner so we got delivery from this place.  I got the Laad Naa Seafood Combo (pan fried wide noodles with Chinese broccoli in brown gravy with seafood) for $13.

The entree was rather large (bigger portion than I expected) and came in one of those black microwavable dish.  

Nice rich gravy, nice load of seafood, great taste. Definitely would order form here again the next time I'm in Vegas although some of my friends didn't like their entrees.

Been to Kung Fu a few times. LOVE IT. Its always pretty full when we go so it makes it a better experience to people watch. I always the Tom Yum soup with shrimp. Love the spyciness. I also recommend the walnut shrimp if you like sweet food. Place seems clean and waitress is always sweet.

Food isn't bad but service was awful! Orders came out individually and waiters aren't as attentive. They require a 15% tip for a party of 6 or more and I honestly don't think they deserve it. They treat their own people with more attention than others...discriminates and slow in service, not coming back for sure.

Went to Kung Fu yesterday with my mom and it was our first time to eat there was recommended by a friend to try it out, food was awesome and delicious! Been to a few Thai restaurant in Vegas but Kung Fu is hands down is the best tasting Thai food!!! Service is excellent....this is now my fav Thai restaurant. I ordered the Panang Curry Beef, Pork Garlic Pepper Sauce, Egg Fried Rice and of course to push it down with a nice glass of Thai Iced Tea!

The best Chinese restaurant in Vegas. Plus, it is so close to the strip. 
Go to other Chinese restaurants in China Town--- EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK!
Most of the other Chinese food establishments in China Town are horrible. I have been to at least 10. Kung Fu is strong!!

This is an Asian restaurant that offers a Thai and Chinese menu. The restaurant looks old and outdated, however, the food is very good. I was also surprised with the portion sizes as they were pretty generous at a reasonable price point. 

We ordered the Tom Yum Kha which had a very traditional Thai flavor. We also ordered beef and broccoli, pat see ew and the Thai beef salad which were all good choices. The best dish was the combination fried rice which was very tasty. We also had the sweet green chicken curry which was somewhat of a disappointment and I would not recommend it. I guess the part that I did not enjoy was the fact that they used cucumbers for this dish. 

Other than the curry, the flavors were great with mainly all of their dishes. So whenever you cannot decide between Chinese or Thai food, you can come to this restaurant and have the best of both worlds! Again, not a fancy place but this is a good and reasonable priced restaurant.

KUNG FU KICKED TO 2 STARS

   Kung Fu Restaurant broke an important rule. That rule is to NEVER EVER force your customers to leave a minute after giving them the check. Breaking this rule has consequences such as A ONE STAR REDUCTION IN A REVIEW RATING. As a result of their unprofessional action a 3.4 rating is dropped to 2.4 stars that is rounded off to 2 stars. Yikes! kind of how my brother and I also felt. In all honesty this a gentle response considering that many talented Yelper's would reward this experience with a one star rating. 

  Kung Fu Restaurant is located in the Las Vegas Chinatown District at the southwest corner of Valley View and Spring Mountain Boulevard. After a day in Springs Preserve suffering with a hurt left foot my brother and I decided to drive a few traffic lights South on Valley View Boulevard to Chinatown. This would be a convenient choice. Actually not really. Regardless that Kung Fu is at a major crossroads, the parking situation is atrocious. The diminutive parking spaces are more ideal for a golf cart than today's modern vehicles. I'd sacrifice my car if I left it there. So, we parked across Valley View Boulevard near Starbuck's with the intention of a post dinner coffee after. So I'd sacrifice my legs and limbs crossing a busy Valley View Boulevard.

  The service started out allright. Immediately after walking inside there was a booth available (I wonder why). The waiter presented my brother and I with glasses of cold water and the menus. 

  Regardless that there was a large assortment of dishes to choose from, only the entree page dishes included jasmine rice. Nothing about brown or fried rice. I ordered the shrimp chop suey which was around $9.50. My taste buds say that the shrimp chop suey is 3.4 stars. In comparison to the Chinese restaurants that I have reviewed (my Chinese Restaurants list is the home of these reviews) the size of the shrimps trailed in comparison. Generally speaking, or tasting the quality from the vegetables to the sauce tasted fine. The soy sauce gave some taste to the jasmine rice.  With the shrimp chop suey and jasmine rice, I ordered hot tea. In my opinion it is nearly impossible to mess up the delicious hot tea that Chinese restaurants serve. After a few cups of the delicious green tea, I stand by my opinion. Thanks to the Yelp checkin offer, the tea was complimentary. I would of enjoyed a bowl of my beloved wonton soup,  one of my favorite foods in the world going back to my toddlerhood. But Kung Fu doesn't give any breaks with the soup. The war won ton soup is around $9. they ought to include personal portions of soup on the menu. Then again, they ought to include chopsticks on the table. 

  The food was good. I ate everything down to the plate including the sauce. My brother and I were talking at the time the waiter presented us with the check. Around a minute later the waiter tells us to pay because people were waiting for the booth. He wasn't giving us the stink eye and handed us our fortune cookies. Without a nasty demeanor he just rushing us out of the booth barely giving my brother and I time to split the bill. 

  I didn't read the fortune cookie. An appropriate fortune cookie would say something like, "The average person tells nine other people when they are unhappy with a business where the average Yelper tells a couple thousand people when they are unhappy with a business." Or the fortune cookie might of said, "You have a World of restaurants to choose from in your city." Or the fortune cookie could of said, "There is nothing like competition." To close off this review, what I am saying is that Kung Fu rushed us out the door of their restaurant and it is a door I don't intend to open in a long time.

Been here a few times while in town.  Usually get the typical Thai dishes when I come here w friends.  The papya salad, lad nah seafood, half an order of duck and chinese broccoli.  Looking forward to trying other things on their menu, but so far...so yummy!

The fam & I just checked in to our condo on the strip tired from the very hot drive from L.A.  This was the only place I could find on the book that deliver Chinese food where we are so I took my chances.  I ordered satay chicken, shrimp pad thai, mongolian beef, shrimp Thai fried rice, whole deep fried catfish, chicken panang, papaya salad and steamed rice ( I know it sounds a lot, but I also have the parents w/us), bill came up to $72.  The satay had a good flavor and not dry like some places.  Their menu said the shrimp pad thai and shrimp fried rice comes with plump shrimp ...what we got in these dishes looked very small and not as advertised---very disappointing.  The flavors were good though but they shouldn't have underlined "plump shrimp".  The cat fish was very good and almost made up for the shrimp.  The papaya salad had a good flavor but I would have liked the papaya shredded thinner.  Everything else was so-so, I've had better.  My dad liked it for the spiciness.
They delivered our food fast and it was delicious. It's hands down one of the best places to eat Chinese food.

Yelp reviews raved about this place so we came. I was hoping for more. We were sat at a table too large for two people in the middle of the room. When a booth became available I asked to move and was told no. That pretty much ended my liking this place, but wait- maybe the food will save it? 
We ordered a sampler appetizer plate. It was good and I really liked the shrimp. I grew up eating at a Chinese restaurant that was a family favorite and they were very much like my favorite place. What I ordered for dinner was not as satisfying in fact I was going to give the leftovers to the crazy homeless guy outside on the street but I didn't. It didn't get eaten at all. 
No one that works there is very friendly unless you are a regular. 
overall we will not return. (luckily, my husband liked what he ordered and ate it all)
Favourite Thai place in Vegas!

My husband and I always eat here. Love this place. The closest to my moms cooking. Sunny (one of the staff members) is always so kind/nice to us! Our usual Thai spot. Food is awesome if you know what to order.

No romantic dinner or lunch.Great place for Pad Thai,chicken fried rice,sweet&sour soup,curry dishes.TOM YUM soup is perfect.I spent about 5 years around Thailand...This is good food.Place looks old,but very clean.You can tell by the cleanliness of the restroom.

Spent Christmas Evening here :-) food was awesome!! The wait was pretty long but we expected it since it was Christmas. Anyway it was defiantly worth the wait. The staff was great, they were all running around trying to accommodate everyone as best as they could. The food came out fairly quick and I was really pleased with what we ordered. The Angus beef salad was my favorite :-) so yes we will definitely be back soon to try all the other items on the menu.

On a budget [lost all of your money or planning on losing it?] but still want to eat good?  This place is freaking AWESOME.  A DEFINITE must-have in your Vegas trip's arsenal of contingency plans for when you are too hung over to leave the hotel for food, too broke or sick of the room service food, and you want variety.  They have an extensive menu, and they DELIVER?!?  

I expected the Mr. Chau/Panda Express equivalent of Chinese fast food, so I was not excited whatsoever.  When the boyfriend read off the menu options and said they had an extensive Thai menu as well, I already knew what I wanted: Their green coconut curry w/ chicken.  I don't remember what the hell else everyone ordered, but it was all in my belly quick, and the coconut curry was the BEST I've had, hands down.  The chicken was tender and moist, the veggies were crisp, and the curry itself was a sweet and spicy blend of perfection.  Not too salty, and not too bland.

I was surprised the price we paid, and bitter we wasted almost double that on 3/4 less food from room service the night prior.  We also waited JUST AS LONG for our food, too!  

Definitely put this place on your speed-dial when you're there.  It was nice to have a break from the traditional American food fare at all the buffets, and even better: it saved us $$$ when feeding a grip of hungry and broke people chillin' in our hotel room.  

Convenience, price, speed, service, good Asian food = 5 stars.

I work at the SLS Hotel & Casino and my co-worker and I ordered food from here for delivery. Between the two of us, we ordered the chicken fried rice, chicken pad siew-ew, and the pad woon sen. I would have added pictures to this review, but I was so hungry when the food got here I completely forgot to take pictures, ha!

The process to order online was seamless and, for an Asian food restuarant, in my opinion, ahead of the game in comparison to other restaurants (http://www.kungfuplaza.com/). Their website is very clean and well laid out. It lists out all of their food items, descriptions of the foods, as well as pictures. When you go to check-out you fill in all of your information and it offers places to add comments should there be any special requests, option to add tip, as well as an option to pick when you want your food delivered (in case you were ordering for later and would not have time to put an order in or for future deliveries).

I was sent an emailed receipt detailing all of the tidbits I added on to my order including my instructions on where to drop off and which number to call upon arrival and a breakdown of the receipt. I don't usually get impressed by a site or receipt so it says a lot when I say I was very impressed by this.

Upon arrival, the driver called to let me know he was five minutes away and where he would be. The food was fresh and was still piping hot when I took it back to the office. It was very flavorful and they gave us so much for the price!

Thanks, Kung Fu! We will be ordering again.

I like this place. Service is fast and the food is good. They have a great variety of Asian styles. I like their lunch specials which are really cheap and you get a lot for what you pay for. I come here twice a month.
This is a staple lunch place. They have Thai and Chinese on the menus, though I've never had the Thai. The lunch specials are good, quick, and very price worthy.

This place has great food. The Mongolian beef, orange chicken, and pot stickers are all great choices.
The service is decent. I've been to worse. 
Over all it's a good choice

A TERRIBLE SERVICE from a woman server named , Jen today @ this restaurant. Thanks to her cuz will never come back no more to spend my money in this rude server Thai restaurant.I spent too much money and the lady is so rude. She's not supposedly in this kind of business cuz all she got is her mad face all the time.  We're not spending money juz to be treated bad. I hope the management can do something  about this it's ruining the image of this good restaurant

This absolute &@"-&!?&@ of a restaurant decided it would be smart to close the restrooms for over 20minutes while patrons waited to use the restroom during their evening dining hours. I insisted after 20 minutes to use it. They finally let me use it and what's funny is that nothing was unclean and also after making a slight scene one of their workers suddenly decided to roll a mop bucket toward the restrooms at that time.  Unsure what all that was about it but I suggest any and all of Vegas and visitors to never patronize this place.
Saayywhaaa???!!!  I have been in Vegas all my life and am so MAD I didn't discover this one sooner.  GREAT food GREAT service.

I've eaten here twice, and the first time I thought that I really liked it, but that must have been because I was still intoxicated...It is Vegas after all! On my second time back here, I had the duck noodle soup and tom yum soup again, and DAMN were they OILY. I felt like I was just drinking luke warm oil. The pad thai and the curry I had we're just okay. I don't think I'll be coming back here, I didn't feel so good after eating here... Look elsewhere and don't let other drunken people convince you it's good.

With all the great reviews on here I was really excited to try it. I was so disappointed. We walked in and it was if we were non existent. No hello.. No eye contact. We stood there and wondered do we seat ourselves? Finally someone seats us.. I think it took 10 minutes for a server to get to our table. He was indifferent and kind of ignored is the rest of the night.

Now the food.. Ugh. I ordered egg flower soup .. It was so thick I couldn't stomach it. Mongolian beef was okay .. Very small portion and I don't eat that much. Egg foo young looked gross on the plate. It tasted okay.. I mean it's only eggs. It just wasn't that great like I thought it would be.

Ive gone here multiple times on Vegas and it hits the spot every time! I went a few weeks ago though and found the waitress a leetle on the rude side, but everything else was fine.

This place has a large menu and has thai dishes, but also some chinese ones as well! I guess that makes sense since the place is called kung fu? Lol.

Ive tried multiple items and liked everything. I am boring and almost always get a pad thai though. Found the noodles to be a little sog this last visit, but flavor was good.

Enjoyed the Mongolian Beef based on a friends recommendation and was not disappointed.  Service was so outstanding the water in our glasses appeared full the whole meal.  Business has been around for 42 years and now I know why.  The owner greeted us halfway thru the meal and couldn't believe it was my first time to visit her establishment.  She informed me all dishes are made to order with an option on every dish of 1 to 10 on how spicy you like it.  You can definitely taste the difference in the pride and quality of the food and service.  Will be back again!!

This is my second time at this restaurant.everything
From decor to sitting is awesome.
Food taste great.every-time when I go to Vegas this is going to be my place.

Ordered for pickup through the website. Immediately after I was finished I get a phone call asking if I can be there in 20 minutes to pickup the order. As I'm pulling up to the restaurant I get another call asking if I was on my way. I tell them I'm pulling in. I walk in, tell a server I was here for a pickup order, he said he was going to go get it, 10 minutes later, nothing. So I take a play out of their book and call them, tell them I'm standing up front, she says "oh, okay, we'll bring it out to you". 15 minutes later, nothing, so here I am 25 minutes later standing here writing a review and still no order. If you're going to be so adamant about me picking up my order, maybe you should have the order completed in the first place. Overpriced, mediocre food with terrible service.

Ended up in this disaster after one of our usual places was full of a tour group. It took around 10 minutes for anyone to come to the table to take our order after being sat. Little did we know this was the beginning of a pattern.My coworkers and I ordered off of the lunch menu (which for the price looks pretty good, I guess that is what gains them the one mandatory star above). Then the waiting game it took a very long time to get the food. The lunch special comes with egg and flour soup which we received first. It was bland and not very good, had to add soy sauce to it to make it even palatable. About 30 plus minutes later we received our entrees. The food was underwhelming at best. I had the Kung Pao chicken with fried rice, egg roll and Thai fried chicken wing. The chicken wing and egg roll were not too bad, but the rest was sub par and not very good. I believe I could have gotten a better meal at an Asian fast food restaurant. Then it took close to 15 minutes to get our check, followed by another long wait to get it back. It caused one of my coworkers to miss a meeting. Not sure how this place has made it as long as it has.

Traveling all day and wanted a good meal to end our night. The service was great and on time. The food was delish. A bit pricey but hey I'm from Texas where Asian food is not king. Definitely will call on them again when I'm in Vegas and need food delivered.
Was staying in Vegas for the weekend and wanted some Chinese food. Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try? Glad I did! Food was very delicious and tasty, service was good!

Tried this place for the first time tonight based on the other yelp reviews. I am so disappointed because I was expecting their menu to have basic chinese dishes like crispy house noodles, crispy duck, honey walnut shrimp, and bbq pork. Everything I wanted was not available or was altered from what I was used to. We ended up ordering chicken chow mein, kung fu duck and orange chicken. The chow mein was oily and reminded me of the chow mein you get at the fast food mall food court. The duck was good, wished that it was crispy. The orange chicken was overcooked and somewhat burnt. It contained mostly batter. A problem we had was that we ordered the duck quarter size because it was just my husband and I and they ended up giving us the half size. We thought it was big but we were hungry and no one came to check on us for us to let them know. We never realized it was half until we got the check and we already ate half so we just paid for it without complaining because it took them almost ten minutes to grab our payment. This is definitely a place I will not be coming back fo chinese again.

I would love to give 5 stars, and if it was based off strictly food and price it would be. Very affordable and very good food. Some of my favorite fried rice in Vegas and hard to put down once you start eating. I haven't sat down to eat here yet but ordered take out a few times.

If they are not busy, take out is fairly easy as someone usually sees you walk in and comes to help you. However on busy nights such as this past Monday, I went in to pick up my food and waited about 10 minutes before someone acknowledged me being there. I then waited close to 10 minutes for them to ring me up in the back along with another guy who was there before me while our food sat there bagged up on the table. Food was still very hot when i got home so no issues there, just think they should have a dedicated "host/ess" when you walk in. If you walk in now, it's like whoever is available will come over and seat you or take your order.

Seemed like many of the people sitting at the restaurant were frustrated with wait times for food or service as well. Saw one guy get up and go grab the water jug from the server stand since nobody was coming to his table to refill and one table had to grab a server so that they would take the order for the table.

Minus the obvious service issues on busy nights, I highly recommend this place for the food! We have enjoyed all dishes we have had and I absolutely love the fried rice.

I guess if you have a Thai craving in LV, this would be the place to go. 

They're actually a mixture of Thai, Chinese and Laos.

I dined here back in January and I can't really remember anything exceptional about this place except I enjoyed the papaya salad.

Its your typical Chinese/Thai food restaurant. It's better as family style rather than individual meals, so sharing is caring folks!

I'm sure we will be back whenever we hit Vegas up and we're not at the buffet. LOL.

I really like this place.
When we first moved here, we looked for a Thai place, and we couldn't believe how many were here!
And most of them were within a city block of one another.
So, naturally, we had to try each one.
And, they were all pretty good.
But this place was better.
The Tom Yum Gai (chicken lemongrass soup) was the best by far.
If you get the two-person portion, it's enough for three or four.
After the soup, my wife is done, but I get a plate of Thai Bok Choy (Chinese cabbage cooked Thai style).
Very fresh and the flavor really shines.
The fact that they combine Thai and Chinese foods on their menu, is really smart.
I've gone there for lunch, early dinner, late dinner, Christmas Eve, and Christmas day, and they're always almost full, but I've never had to wait for a table.
It's a pretty sizable place.
I don't drink, but you can't miss the huge bar on the right side of the dining room.
Service is good, prices are reasonable.
I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!

I hate being lied to.

The food there is good; not any better than any Thai place in town and a little worse than Komol and Lotus of Siam, but OK.

The service is sub-standard, but not glaringly so.

The wait times for food is unusually long; perhaps because they are trying to get you to drink more.

But they lie.

First off, never ever ever order order for pick up.  They will wait for you to show up to begin making it so you do not cheat them by a no show.  They will lie to you when you get there and say it "almost done" and immediately run you card, and then you will wait between 30-40 minutes for the food.

If you call and get them to promise they will make it and it will be waiting hot, they will still lie, and say they will.  And they will not.

This happened to me 4 times before I gave up on them, as they are the closest Thai place to my home and therefor a logical choice if we want a quick dinner.

Then we went to do deliveries at our home from them, as they we the only Thai place that we could find that delivered.  A guy came for several times, we paid a good tip and there were no issues, and then, out of the blue, the person answered the phone told us they they could not deliver to our area, it was "too far."  When we pointed out to them that they had delivered several times before, the person on the phone informed us categorically that they had never delivered to that area and accused us of lying.  We shrugged, figured we had someone new or crazy or what not, ordered someplace else and moved on.  A few weeks later we tried to order again, a different person answered the phone and again categorically informed us they had never delivered to the area where our home was located.

A change in policy because we were too far away . . . fine.  But it doesn't sit with me well how easy and enthusiastically they lie.

Their food ain't bad, but it is not worth putting up with their service or their lying.

play it safe and stick with some tom yum soup and pad see ew. 

tom yum soup was delicious, i like that they bring the hot pot thing out to your table so you can help yourself.

my friend had the pad see ew w/shrimp and i ate more of her food than my own. they give you a generous amount of large shrimp and it goes well with the thick flat noodles, egg, and garlic-y sauce. 

i had this rice dish...rice with spicy deep fried cat fish fillets . it was a mess of unidentifiable pieces of fish smothered in brown sauce on top of rice. NO BUENO. and they mean BUSINESs when they ask you how spicy you want your food on a scale from 1-10. i LOVE spicy, so i asked for an 8 and it was borderline that i-cant-enjoy-my-food stage for me. 

service was great, my friend ordered this garlic chili beef dish and asked for it to be spicy level 8. she was dying, and i must admit, though delicious, i don't think i can enjoy eating an entire meal like that. she told the server it was way too spicy and couldn't eat it, and they happily made her another order, less spicy. i thought that was super nice of them because i'd probably tell the person "too bad," since they should know to order at their own risk! 

Moral of the story: even if you love some kick to your food and (think) you can handle really spicy food, order a lower level...you can always add them to add more spice if it's not suitable!

This place has great food, and decent service.  But it was deaaaaaaad, at 9pm on a Friday.  It is a medium sized restaurant (maybe 20-30 tables?), and about 60% of the tables were unoccupied.  

I'm sorry, but when the restaurant is so empty, you can't help but wonder whether you made a good choice, even if the food tastes wonderful.

Maybe we just picked an off day.
Just tried their food, it was amazing! Very tasty. I loved the beef and garlic sauce, and the chicken chowmein. It's kind of pricey, but overall it was good.
Good menu. Fair service. Fair prices Casual  full bar   Something for everyone   can't complain

After a busy week in Vegas, and simply not feeling great, I decided to order for delivery, and I am glad I did. I ordered the Chicken Satae and the Chicken, Garlic and Pepper, and both were very good. 
I had lunch in China Town yesterday and was very disappointed. It turns out I just went to the wrong place. I will definitely come back to this place the very next time I'm in Vegas. 
Delivery time was prompt too.

Omg!! Pad see ew with deep fried pork belly(moo grob)....a must order
Not on the menu but ask for it
5 stars!! everything else is ok

I am going straight neutral on Kung Fu, but I have to erase from my memory the unswept, noodle-laden floor. When we arrived on a Sunday evening, the floor was a disaster. My husband said, "Don't look down." Good advice.

Moving beyond the floor, which I am sure at times is immaculate, we came in to try some Thai. When I go for Thai, I go for curry. I ordered the panang tofu, as that was the curry listed under their vegetarian selections. I forgot to ask if they were able to do soft tofu instead of fried, and the dish came with fried. I thought the tofu was perhaps over-fried, as the texture was a bit chewy, and the flavor a little greasy. As for the curry itself, it had a very heavy peanut flavor. Based on what I know, the inclusion of peanuts in curry is sometimes a personal preference of the chef, and some people may enjoy the flavor. However, for me, it was overly sweet and the curry was incredibly thick. I kept telling my husband that it tasted like peanut butter and tofu, which wasn't pleasing to my taste buds. This is not a dish I would order again.

The service was efficient.

One bad dish and some lackluster floors creates a less than ideal first impression. Still, there is a whole menu of potential, so as I said in the beginning, I'll stay neutral.

We found our favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas! Just the right amount of spice (heat) at #5. 

The chicken with chili and mint is amazing the Thai food is so authentic it's like being back in Bangkok

This place is the best Thai/Chinese food place on Valley View Rd! We went here with a group and could not believe how extensive the menu was. We each ordered a plate and shared it. There was even plenty enough to share with even more people. The service was great and attentive. They even have a bar inside. This place is open until 1am.

Love all the different spots in China Town!  Cesar Q and I have been craving some authentic Thai food and decided to stop by.

First off they have an awesome lunch menu with multiple options for under $7 and it includes soup of the day and some killer little appetizers.  

Of course we can't be as simple as their lunch menu we opt for the bigger is better option and order directly off the menu.  I ordered the chicken pad Thai and my man had the combination pad Thai.  We split a bbq pork fried rice.  Needless to say we had a ton of left overs as we could have split one meal and been full.  Everything we ordered was great!  Loved the delicate sauce on the pad Thai.  

Can't beat the location as it's just off spring mountain and valley view.  Just west of I-15 on the Spring Mountain exit.

The service was great.  The guys who assisted us were happy and friendly.  Great Thai find in Vegas!

I've finally had the chance to dine in here, and I'm really pleased with my experience. 

We came in yesterday, Christmas Day, for brunch. 

The place was packed, but they found a small table for the two of us towards the back.
They offer a free soft drink with a Yelp check in, and I was able to "upgrade" to a Thai iced tea for $1 instead of the normal $2.85.  Deal!

Today we ordered a cup of egg flower soup, egg rolls, shrimp Pad Thai, and Mongolian beef.  

I thought the egg flower soup was gross, but I'm not a fan of that style of soup anyway.  My fella LOVED it.  He said it was some of the best egg flower soup he's had in town. 

The egg rolls were amazing, and let me tell you about the hot mustard sauce...wowza, THAT cleared my sinuses after one bite.  It was absolutely amazing, and I usually don't care too much for hot/spicy things.  

The Mongolian beef was delicious:  tender beef with great flavor and a little kick to it, with peppers and onions and carrots.  

The Shrimp Pad Thai was good too...the noodles were perfect.  My only complaint and the reason for the docked star was that the shrimp were REALLY over cooked.  

Service was extremely polite, and quick.  

I absolutely plan to continue to order in from here, and I would definitely dine in again.
This has become our go-to place in town for Thai or Chinese. Consistently good. Staff is not always very friendly, but service is fast and they have an extensive menu.

Needed delivered food due to a knee injury and was looking for a soup high in collagen so my first thought was something Asian. A cab driver had just recommended this place 3 days before. They have Beef Tendon Soup so I knew that would be perfect (I'd never had it). When I saw online ordering- whoohoo! No language/accent barriers with ordering . I also got Jumbo Shrimp Curry and Tom Yum Mixed Seafood Soup, and my daughter got Orange chicken and egg roll. What a great meal and the delivery time was fast. It exceeded  my expectations and I absolutely loved the curry, and the soup was also very good. We'll definitely be repeat customers.
Had the lunch special orange chicken. It was really good. Came with one chicken wing, fried rice, egg drop soup and a veggie roll. The portion was just right for lunch.

I am a fan of Pad Thai so every Thai restaurant that I go to, I get this. While I wasn't impressed with the tom yum soup, Kung Fu has a delicious Pad Thai that can beat Lotus of Siam's Pad Thai any day of the week. Get this item here if you love pad thai!!!

I'm accustomed and miss my N.Y. Chinese food.
Please don't suggest PF Chang's, that's a glorified chili's for a Chinese food. 
A friend dines here and suggested we go before heading to Golden Tiki.  Perfecto! Same shopping center, plus for that!
They don't use MSG, huge plus for that.  Always a warm greeting when entering and seated immediately. They do have a bar area with seating, however the tables are flushed against the seats- don't expect to sit at the bar anytime soon. 
Portions are to be shared, or not if one is hungry and then you can surely have it all for yourself.  I have!  The three times I've been here the food comes out quickly after ordering and steaming hot!  They are also very accommodating when switching something for your tastebuds.
Three stars, since it's not my 'N.Y. Chinese' food.  
That being said, I've more than likely made an attempt at most of the Chinese places in town.  This is the only one I enjoy.

we tried their chicken pad thai to-go for 8.60.

- fast service. we order right when we got there and it took about 10m for us to get the food.
- good to-go portion. nice to-go plates and utensils. 
- taste like "fast-food" pad-thai. i'm not thai, but the noodles are wrong. ruins the essence of pad thai. thin, short, viet style noodle in pho? horrible.

Called ahead and placed a to-go order. Omg! I'm still sitting her 45 minutes in, they have you pay as soon as you walk in to hold you here. The food is okay but not worth spending all day waiting for something I could've ordered next door. They ignore the large parties who want to pack food up. Never again!

Ok so I went with a Thai girl and had no idea what I was eating. She was kind and ordered a creamy chicken soup that was excellent. A ground beef thing over rice that was spicy but really good, Also had something that looked like beef jerky that was soft in the middle and very good. A full Chinese menu is also offered, 

Thai tea is recommended.

A great place for lunch if you have a couple of hours to spare. This restaurant offers the best lunch specials for $5.99 which includes soup, a chicken wing and egg roll, rice and your entree...what else can you ask for? The staff is very friendly and are always keeping an eye on your table to make sure your glass is always full and your table is cleared of dirty dishes.

You can also try this place for dinner as they have quite an extensive Chinese and Thai food menu. However, if want to order off the regular menu, please make sure you bring someone with you because all the dishes are big enough to share.

Met some friends for dinner. By the time I had got there, they had already ordered dinner. It was no more than maybe five minutes and the first dish was already coming out. We started with the Seafood Tom Yum Soup. The light tangy soup was not a hit with everyone. The broth was filled with mussels, shrimp, squid, fish filet, and mushrooms. From that point on, the food came out in rapid secession. The Combination Pad Thai was lacking flavor compared to the Pork Pad See Ew. Now that we have eaten every animal on land and sea we got an order of Sauteed Chinese Broccoli. 

The service is quick and attentive, Our water glasses were always full and dirty dishes were taken away quickly. The food is a safe bet. Another reason why we are always back here.

First time at Kung Fu Thailand & Chinese. The employees are super nice and attentive.  

We order the General Tso Chicken, their famous fried rice with pineapple, shrimp, vegetables chop suey and hot and sour soup. Everything was delicious, hot and fresh.

For a Saturday night it wasn't busy could be the weather or time. Happy we didn't have to get seated.

I don't live in proximity to Kung Fu but I had an appointment in the area and it was recommended to me. I was told I have to try the duck. Since I'm always game to try things that people seem to be so passionate about, I thought why not?

First I will say that the parking was a bit confusing. Kung Fu is located in a strip mall on Spring Mountain but the actual restaurant faces Valley View. You can't actually see it from the parking so you really have to know that it's there or you would totally miss it.

After looking through the pretty extensive menu we decided on the Crab Rangoon for an appetizer, the half duck and the chicken Pad Thai. Well one of my pet peeves is when the appetizer arrives the same time as the entree which is what happened here. I still can't figure out why anyone would rave about the duck. It was super rubbery and none of the fat was rendered. The Pad Thai was solid however but not enough of a reason to come back. And lastly, the service was not very attentive. We even had to wave someone down to get our check.

China Town has so many great restaurants in the area but this one is not going to be on my radar in the future unfortunately.

I am definitely a fan!!! And they deliver! I'm a huge fan of places that serve white meat. The orange chicken is amazing! Pad Thai, amazing! Thank you! Can't wait to have it again this week!

Update: Just had this again, yup! Still great!  Mongolian beef was soooo good! I love places that have good quality meat. That's hard to find around this area.

You gotta love the Asian place that has a duel menu, Thai and Chinese. We're here today for Chinese.  The place isn't very busy, almost a bit concerning, perhaps a warning?  We came in anyway.

After looking over the menu, we picked out a soup, a noodle dish and a few more Chinese dishes.  The food took some time, which was kinda weird since they weren't very busy!  When the food started coming out, it was one at a time, we generally enjoy family style, with a little bit of each on our plates, but the food was so slow, we had time to eat one at a time. 

The food as good, very good flavor and we weren't disappointed, but the service wasn't what we're used too!

Ordered take out/delivery to our accounting office -- ordered 5 lunch specials @ $6.25 each.  Although cheap we were all disappointed with flavor and portion serving.  Most on plate was rice...3
of 5 plates were pad Thai and the serving was so small and not much of flavor.  Came with a small egg roll and chicken wing.  Deliv charge was $3...def not worth it and we won't be ordering anytime soon...very disappointed.

Love their chopped chicken with mint and pineapple fried rice.  I used to live fairly close and this was the go to Thai restaurant for my roommate and me.  Delivery was always super quick, orders were always correct and everything we ever orderd was delicious!
This restaurant is tucked outside the strip. A hidden gem, the food here is very sumptuous and economical

Very good menu selection with many many items that will please anyone's appetite. I always get the Thai tea and it's not too much tea and not too much cream so it's perfect. The egg foo young is great with lots of toppings and the Tom yum shrimp soup is flavorful and filled with a good amount of shrimp. Definitely visiting again. Docked one star because when they're busy service is slow.

I have been to Thailand and i have tried everything from street foods to gourmet dining and bizzare foods. If you want to try the favorites like yellow curry, gree, red or Panang, pad thai, pad prik, pad se ew or thai chicken, spicy catfish basil...... These guys have it all and it is the closest tasty thai cultural food you can eat if you miss it back home in Thailand. Staff is friendly, a little slow on service at times since some servers are not always at their side to serve their tables but the food is exceptional and still brings me back. I usually take mine to go. Kung Fu also serves chinese so yes you will also find duck in the menu.
Great food large portion. Price is good for the amount you get. I would recommend this place if you are in the mood for Thai or Chinese

I went to Kung Fu because I, and two friends, were in the mood for Thai Food around 10 pm, and that was the first restaurant we saw when we arrived in Chinatown.   We shared chicken satay and fried won ton as appetizers, and shared three entrees:  chicken with spicy garlic, sweet and sour pork and seafood pad thai.  

Our waiter was new to the job and had to be urged to check with someone to give us information about the drinks at the bar (rather than just saying "I don't know" and leaving us with that) but he redeemed himself by returning with the owner, who explained the ingredients of the pina colada, and told us that the pina coladas and mai tais are the most popular bar drinks requested.

As far as cleanliness, the nasty-looking carpeting was a problem. I believe the furnishings were rather worn-looking as well, but the space is brightly lit and relatively spacious.  The decor was nothing to write home about; the place is basically a white box with decorative Thai art and dusty-looking travel posters on the walls.

But we came for the food, and I must say that everything was delicious.   For all of the above orders, a beer and a Pepsi, the bill came only to about $50, which isn't bad.  We all said we'd come back.

This is a review of their take-out service; I'm sure the experience is different in the restaurant itself. Also, I'm not entirely sure if the take-out menu has all the items that are in the in-house menu. I have never been to the restaurant itself. Decided to try the take-out menu because one of us was feeling sick and was not up to going to the casinos for a meal. We were staying at a timeshare near the strip that did not have room service.

First, I tried ordering online because they have a convenient online ordering system through their website at kungfuplaza.com. The ordering system was very well organized, with pictures of the food you're ordering. However, after putting in my order, the final page indicated that the delivery address was my credit card's billing address which is in another state and not the hotel that I was staying in. I cancelled the order and called in the order instead. The woman who took the order had a strong accent, but she got my order right. The woman asked for spiciness level on a scale of 1 to 10, with one being really spicy. I was quite tickled by this method. Food arrived exactly an hour later as promised. There is a charge for delivery; I think it was six dollars or thereabouts. If paying by credit card over the phone, the delivery person will ask to see the credit card that you paid with along with a picture id. 

The dishes were good; nothing spectacular, but sufficient for a take-out. The seafood tom yum had very little seafood but quite tasty. The roast pork noodle was okay. Pad Thai was quite good, and so was the beef larb. Portions were good, neither too little nor too much.  Thai iced-tea was delicious. The restaurant included Styrofoam bowls and plates, and plastic forks, knives, and spoons. They also did not skimp on the paper napkins, fortune cookies, and hot pepper sauce.  All in all, a good take-out experience and I would definitely order take out from them again. For the four dishes, drinks, a side-order of  steamed rice, and delivery charge, dinner was about fifty dollars.

Very accommodating! Our daughter made reservations for her friends for Homecoming and they had no problems with all 20 kids(plus all the driving parents!)  being at the restaurant. The food was good. We got steamed potstickers (will do fried next time) Mongolian beef (oh my gosh the sauce is awesome!) and cashew chicken (just sweet enough to be perfect!). Service was great for a Saturday night with an almost full house! Our waitress was quite attentive and we didn't ever have to worry about refills. Prices were reasonable for the area. We will be back!

I love this place, when I use to live in Vegas... every visitors I had, I would take them here to eat.  It's nothing fancy and since I use to be such a regular here, always good service.  The food is very delicous and I always leave this place satisfied.  

Away from the strip and into china-town, this place is a little gem hidden at the corner of the street...... the portion size is great, and a family dining oriented restuarant that's able to seat large parties.  In general, the food is GOOD.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant that I've ever ate at in the United states. It's better than all the Thai places that I've had in california, and trust me I've had a lot. I love their spicy shrimp salad, pad Woon sen, and Tom yum soup. Everything is so flavorful and amazing. I'm also in love with their Thai iced coffee. I can't find another place that makes their drinks as good as this place. I wish this place was in oc so I could go every week. However since it's in vegas, I always make a stop here when I go to vegas. Love this place and I would highly recommend it to everyone. Nice servers and workers as well.
Best Chinese food I've had in vegas ! The sweet and sour chicken is good quality chicken, best I've ever had!

This was such a delightful, hidden gem in Chinatown. I've lived in Vegas for 13 years, and I just recently discovered this restaurant thanks to my cousin who visits annually from California (and apparently has been coming to Kung Fu Thai every year for the last 5 years... TFTI). 

Trying to find parking sucks since it's located in the same strip mall as Pho Kim Long, Lee's Sandwiches, etc. However, since Kung Fu Thai is located more towards the side of the building, on the corner of Spring Mountain & Valley View, I was later advised that there's more parking in an alley-ish on Valley View (*Will be more concise & update next time I go). 

I got there around 3 on a weekday, and it was PACKED, and it grew even busier the closer it got to dinner time. So I can only imagine how crazy busy it can get actually during dinner and/or on the weekends. I would advise to go early. 

The food is amazing & it's served "family-style." Unless you're like me & my family and eat A LOT in one sitting, then you could probably keep one entree order all to yourself (or three).
Worst shrimp egg fu young ever. No egg just chopped celery with miniature shrimp. Fried noodle were sweet and oily never again

Amazing! Yum-tom soup is the best!! You have to try !!! Very delicious. Great customer service. Delicious food. Amazing atmosphere.  Best I've ever tried. I will definitely recommend to family & friends.

The thai iced coffee, green curry and chicken fried rice were all delicious and the curry came with a cup of white rice. The tom kha soup was also relatively good, and the service was excellent. Everyone was very nice and helpful.
Great food, growing up around Chinese food, I can say this is so much like home flavors. Love it.

Orange chicken, Pad Thai, Tom Yum soup, and Pork BBQ fried rice ($50ish) 
*
This place was a few minutes walk away from our Airbnb so we decided to check it it. Service was slow, but it was also Mother's Day and they were busy. The food came fast after they got our order. They were all alright. Highlight was the Tom yum soup that came in the traditional flaming bowl. It had the wow factor and good sour taste.

Have been going to this place since I was a kid!  The food is consistent and very flavorful with mostly Thai dishes and some Chinese dishes mixed into the menu.  Staples include the pad Thai, curries and salads that are great family style.  They've recently renovated the restaurant so it doesn't look as run down as it used to be which shows how long this place has been around.  Tom yum soup is served in a nice flaming pot to keep the soup hot and is very flavorful.  Only issue with the food is sometimes they use too much grease and oil in their dishes so I recommend saying light oil!

Cant deny food is amazing service is horrible!  Always a wait even when slow n called in they'll say 15 when really 30 for to go takes forever for someone to acknowledge but price is good and food I'd great when correct

We ordered carryout for a party of 6. After waiting 45 minutes for delivery it still hadn't arrived and after 30 more minutes and numerous calls to the restaurant and driver our food finally arrived. The food was phenomenal but it would've been nice to be compensated for the wait time or at least them called us to say sorry driver was lost instead of us having to find out what the hold up was. If our food was delivered timely we would've given 5 stars. It was that good!

Ate here with a friend yesterday and ordered off the vegetarian menu. Basically came with garnish, no added vegetables and was very bland. Took the rest home to my boyfriend. He ate it. Long story short all 3 of us are sick today. If you wanna avoid a sour stomach avoid this place.
simply the best chinese food we have found in las vegas area

Having a craving for Thai food in Vegas once again, my friend recommended yet another she was familiar with. So far, I think you can't really go wrong as pretty much all the Asian restaurants I've been brought to has yet to disappoint me. This place was no different.

It's one of the typical informal Asian restaurants you'll find in Chinatown....dated decor and nothing 5 star about it. That's fine as these places are frequented for the food and not the decor. Not to say there isn't any atmosphere as there's hodge podge of Thai and Chinese antiques and motifs.

Like most Asian restaurants, it's probably best to go in larger groups as there are so many dishes to try and the portions are quite generous. Since it was just my friend and I, we just ordered the fish cakes, Pad See Ew (fried flat rice noodles) and the Pad Wan Sen (fried clear noodles). The flat rice noodles was pretty good, but just a bit sweet for my taste. I had actually ordered the fried clear noodles which were quite delicious. However, I had just had this this dish at another Thai restaurant a few days ago, and the other restaurant's taste edges out this one a bit in terms of taste quality.
