Still good though, and a good sized plate of noodles. The fish cakes were not too bad either, but for some reason parts of it were dry or hard to the chew. 

For a good Thai and Chinese restaurant both in one, and not too far from the strip, then this is definitely a place I'd come to again. Service was good (likely because it wasn't a busy time of day), good sized portions, and the food was worth the money. The other Thai restaurant I really enjoyed was a good 4-5 miles from the strip in a suburban strip mall, and probably a bit too far from the strip to venture out to, unless you have a car and GPS. This place is convenient.

We have been coming here as a family for ten years, my husband and his family has been coming here since they opened. I've celebrated about 4 birthdays here, and many special occasions. It consistently wins Best of Las Vegas, and it doesn't disappoint. It has an extensive menu of authentic Thai and Chinese items. Enough to satisfy the novice, or foodie in your group. When the tour buses from Asia stop in it can get crowded, and it's even busy during the week. The floor is large, and can accommodate large parties. If you're in Vegas and haven't been here you need to stop in. And if you're staying in the strip it's just across the freeway from the strip in the China Town corridor.
Delicious and timely but I ended up sick the next day! Watch out on the seafood options.

Good food, waiter not that attentive.

It's more Thai restaurant than Chinese......

Unmistakably Kung Fu Thai is a hidden gem amidst the easily overpriced Asian cuisine in Las Vegas. Step one to finding delicious and affordable food in Vegas is to get off the strip. So, that's what my family and I did by coming to this restaurant, located in Vegas' "chinatown" or along Spring Mountain Road. 

Come here a little before the usual dinner rush on weekends about 6 o clock to avoid waiting. Right after we arrived, multiple parties came and had to wait for a table because the whole place filled up so quickly. 

You must try the garlic beef, pad thai, and papaya salad. Each dish was executed well and the food was brought out fairly quickly. 

My family ordered 5 dishes for 5 of us and there was still some left over. The total came out to be under $60 which is really not bad at all. 

This place is now on my list for some good Thai home cooking if I'm ever sick of the buffets and sky high prices on the strip. 

P.S. Check in for a free drink, +$1 if the drink is Thai iced tea!

Been here many times, and its always a good meal. Place does get busy, its usually 3/4 full at least everytime I've gone here. My Thai friend loves the food here so it gets high marks for the Thai food.

I usually get Pad See Ew and crab rangoon.....I'm such a lame thai food person. I've also had cashew chicken. They do it really well here though. Service has always been spot on, never had any issues. Just a good solid place to eat, and prices are moderate. 

The only issue would be how busy it is, and with the center tables it can get loud, so its not a place for a romantic quiet meal.

It's surprisingly difficult to find places that deliver in Vegas. Everyone in the office is completely sick of Jason's Deli 3 days in a row, so we tried something different and so glad we did. I've only had the Thai food from Kung Fu, but it's one of the few places in Chinatown that delivers, and figured we'd give their food a try.

We did the order by phone since it was catering, but I was really surprised that their website allows you to do the order online for delivery or pick up. Helps a lot with the language barrier - I don't speak Chinese or Thai, but my coworker made me order (in English!) because she had trouble understanding them. 

We were able to feed 12-14 people for about $160 which is really good. Delivery was on time and there was no minimum or delivery fee. I wasn't blown away by the Chinese food, but it was above average with generous servings at a really reasonable price. I think each half pan was around $40. 

It's not my personal go-to for Chinese or Thai, but the fact that they're cheap, so close to the strip and have delivery makes this place 5-star if you're visiting. Beats paying $25 for sweet & sour chicken from a casino restaurant.

The food was bland it has no taste.  At least it was hot. The place was very clean. The waiters took the order and then delivered it to the table. Then never saw them again. Had to flag down another waiter to get the check.  I do not think I'll go back there. Better Chinese restaurants in Henderson or even Panda express has better flavor.

Last day of vegas behind heading to the airport. We have 5 different dish. Panang curry, combination fried rice, garlic chicken, wanton soup and Pai Thai. First this is the first Thai restaurant that don't serve yellow curry. We heard from the other group said the same thing as well. All the food was below average in my opinion. The panang curry doesn't have any curry favor?, it was made by the peanut butter. The combination fried rice has too much moisture in it. Garlic chicken little too favorful, but if eat it with rice. It will be fine. Pai Thai was kinda disappointing. It lacks favor and it doesn't taste like Pai Thai. It tastes like Chow mein instead. Let's talk about good points for this restaurant. The service from the staff is good and the food come out quickly. The price and food portion is average. Overall, due to the below average of food I probably won't come back.
Terrible service. You will wait forever. Half of staff will avoid eye contact. Some of them quite rude and need good training from someone who really know "customer service" badly.

I ordered a papaya salad delivered the menu reads fresh papaya diced into our fresh coconut sauce with grounded peanuts grounded dried shrimp served along lettuce or cabbage
 THERE WAS NO PAPAYA AND IT WAS SO SPICY I COULDNT EAT IT !!!

We ordered Vegetable Chowmein and Panang Tofu. 
Panang Tofu was really delicious with amazing flavours of grounded peanuts and coconut.
Chowmein was okayish.
Would give it a try only for the Panang Tofu.

Pork jerky, papaya salad, chicken larb were all authentic and excellent. The kids got Asian style fries egg and rice and loved it. I came here with 18 of my Lao relatives last minute and they really liked the food here as well.  Big props to the kitchen and staff for taking us in at 6pm on a sat with no reservations. It's definitely on my hit list for the future.

My Fiance and I were looking for a Christmas Story style Chinese Restaurant for our Christmas dinner. Kung Fu delivered with truely authentic Asian delicacies and personnel.  If we had asked them to sing a Christmas Carol or chop the head off of a duck at our table I bet they would have. 

We knew we were at a great Asian restaurant when we looked around and noticed we were the only two non Asian people in the place. A few others came in later but knowing their own culture embraces the restaurant got us excited.

We weren't disappointed. All four dishes had wonderful flavors and aromas. They tasted very fresh and flavorful. The portion sizes were considerable so trust me you will be taking some home.

Parking did stink but if you can find a spot you won't be disappointed having to park down the block and walking a block or two.

My review probably shouldn't count as I keep it simple with my order and have been eating the exact same thing since 2004. Lemon Chicken and Vegetable Chow Mein. This place can get pack and when it does some of the waiters  can forget you exist. One time we were seated and waited patiently for 20-25mins and no one ever came back to ask us for drinks or take our order so we ended up leaving. I do love this place. And so does my husband. But every time we've been lately the service sucks. Not consistent at all.

This place was recommended to me by a great friend. I am not one to choose Asian food for a meal.  I've tried different Chinese & Thai food restaurants, but I leave un satisfied and not very impressed!

Kung Ku has yet to disappointment me! The food is very flavorful and I have yet to not like something I've ordered.  

The food is served family style and the prices are reasonable!  You won't find yourself waiting long either because the food comes out fast!    If you're in the area, give it try!

The place definitely is a little hole in the wall, definitely not a fancy date place. We decided to try this place since Pho Kim Long was packed, when we sat down I looked over the Yelp reviews and my stomach started to sink...  to the point where I was thinking of walking out, but I decided to stick it out. The calamari came out first, suffice to say DO NOT ORDER that, it was horrible. It was all flour and the squid was rubbery. But thankfully all the other dishes I ordered was ok. My husband loved his pork and garlic dish, the pad see ew beef was good, the Mongolian beef was good too. For me it wasn't fantastically amazing, but for someone who was super hungry, it was good enough. Will I want or crave to go back? Probably not but my husband really loved his pork and garlic so if he begs, I probably will. As for service, it was ok, ambience soso at least my seats weren't torn. Cleanliness ok as well. My overall rating for this place is average, and my advice is just try to avoid the horrible dishes and zone in on the ones that are good.

Fast service and food. Decent prices. 

Ordered the crispy pork and chinese broccoli, fried catfish, beef dish, and tom yum soup. They were all good, standard food.
General Tso's Chicken wasn't bad but it didn't have much sauce.  Wonton soup has soggy wontons and tasted off.  Chicken and broccoli smelled funky.

I noticed that a lot of negative reviews are about service, but I have never had that issue here. They refill our waters quite frequently, a lot better than most other restaurants. Everything that I have ever had at this restaurant has been really good. My top picks are the pad thai, pad si ew, tom yum, and the panang. I have also recently tried the Mongolian beef and that was also delicious! Kung Fu will always be one of my favorite thai and chinese go to. Most people are wary of restaurants that have three stars, but I highly recommend trying this place out. They have been open for decades, they are still here for a reason.
Best spicy catfish in town, pud prig king is a bomb and the best part is ice water is soo good,  (waiter said 4 filters filtration)
